ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: (3) Subsection (2) does not apply if the foreigner
Text: by virtue of a temporary residence permit under section 19c, where the time limit on the approval granted by the Federal Employment Agency is based on a maximum term of employment imposed pursuant to section 42 (1),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: (3) Subsection (2) does not apply if the foreigner
Text: if an extension to the temporary residence permit has been prohibited pursuant to section 8 (2) or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: (3) Subsection (2) does not apply if the foreigner
Text: if the temporary residence permit serves to enable the foreigner to live together or to continue to live together as a family with a foreigner who is only resident in the federal territory for a purpose of an inherently temporary nature, where no independent right of residence would arise if the family unity ended.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The following periods are counted towards the necessary periods pursuant to section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: periods of residence outside of the federal territory during which the foreigner possessed a residence title and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: was resident abroad on account of having been sent to a foreign country in connection with his or her work, provided that such individual periods have not exceeded six months or a longer period stipulated by the foreigners authority pursuant to section 51 (1), no. 7, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the total periods do not exceed six consecutive months or, within the period stated in section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1, a total of 10 months,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: previous periods of residence in the federal territory with a temporary residence permit, permanent settlement permit or EU long-term residence permit, where the foreigner was in possession of a permanent settlement permit or an EU long-term residence permit at the time of leaving the federal territory and the permanent settlement permit or the EU long-term residence permit has expired solely on account of residence outside of member states of the European Union or due to acquisition of the legal status of long-term residence in another member state of the European Union, up to a maximum of four years,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: periods in which the foreigner was entitled to freedom of movement,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: half of any periods of lawful stay for the purposes of study or vocational training in the federal territory,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: in the case of beneficiaries of international protection the period between the date on which the application for international protection was filed and the date on which a residence title was granted on account of the fact that the foreigner was granted international protection. Periods of residence pursuant to section 9a (3), no. 5 and periods of residence in which the foreigner also met the conditions of section 9a (3), no. 3 are not counted. Periods of residence outside of the federal territory do not interrupt the period of residence pursuant to section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1 where the residence outside of the federal territory did not result in expiry of the residence title; such periods are not counted when determining the total duration of residence pursuant to section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1. In all other cases, exit from the federal territory interrupts the period of residence pursuant to section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The following periods of time are counted towards the periods required under section 9a (2) sentence 1 no. 1: periods in which the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: possessed an EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: possessed a residence title issued by another member state of the European Union

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for the purpose of employment in an occupation requiring a higher education qualification for which studies last at least three years and the member state has classified as at least Level 6 of the International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED) or Level 6 of the European Qualifications Framework,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for the purpose of research,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for the purpose of study, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: based on the legal status of a beneficiary of international protection, if the foreigner, as holder of an EU Blue Card, had resided in the federal territory for at least two years at the time of application and possessed an EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union immediately before being granted this EU Blue Card. Subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 4 applies accordingly to previous periods of residence with a residence title granted by another member state of the European Union for the purpose of study. Periods of residence outside of the European Union are not counted. However, such periods do not interrupt the period of residence pursuant to section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1 if they do not exceed 12 consecutive months and if they do not exceed a total of 18 months within the period laid down in section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 1. Sentences 1 to 4 apply accordingly to the foreigner’s dependants who have been granted a temporary residence permit under sections 30 or 32.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a rule, foreigners have a fixed and regular income within the meaning of section 9a (2), sentence 1, no. 2 if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: they have met their tax obligations,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: they or their cohabiting spouses have paid contributions or made adequate provision for an old-age pension in Germany or abroad, unless they have been prevented from doing so by a physical or mental illness or disability,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: they and their dependants living with them as a family unit are protected against the risk of illness and the need for nursing care by statutory health insurance or an essentially equivalent form of insurance coverage which applies for an indefinite period or is extended automatically and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: their regular income comes from an economic activity which they are entitled to pursue and for which they also possess any other necessary permit. In the case of cohabiting spouses, it suffices if one spouse if the fulfils the requirements of sentence 1, no. 4. With regard to the contributions or provisions which are necessary pursuant to sentence 1, no. 2, no higher contributions or provisions are required than the ones stipulated in section 9 (2), sentence 1, no. 3.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Residence titles and applications for asylum
Text: In the absence of a legal entitlement, a foreigner who has filed an application for asylum may be granted a residence title prior to the legally valid completion of the asylum procedure only with the approval of the supreme Land authority, and only when vital interests of the Federal Republic of Germany so require. In the cases of a legal entitlement pursuant to section 18a or 18b, a residence title may be granted prior to the legally valid completion of the asylum procedure only with the approval of the supreme Land authority, and only when vital interests of the Federal Republic of Germany so require.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Residence titles and applications for asylum
Text: A residence title granted or extended by the foreigners authority after the foreigner has entered the federal territory may be extended in accordance with the provisions of this Act, irrespective of whether the foreigner has filed an application for asylum.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Residence titles and applications for asylum
Text: A foreigner whose asylum application has been incontestably rejected or who has withdrawn the asylum application may be granted a residence title before leaving the federal territory only in accordance with the provisions of Division 5. If the asylum application has been rejected in accordance with section 30 (1), nos. 3 to 7 of the Asylum Act (Asylgesetz), no residence title may be granted before the foreigner leaves the federal territory. Sentences 1 and 2 do not apply if the foreigner is entitled to a residence title; further, sentence 2 is not applied if the foreigner meets the requirements for being granted a temporary residence permit pursuant to section 25 (3). No residence title pursuant to section 18a, 18b or 19c (2) may be granted before the foreigner leaves the federal territory if the foreigner’s asylum application has been incontestably rejected. Foreigners who have withdrawn their asylum application may be granted a residence title pursuant to section 18a, 18b or 19c (2) before leaving the federal territory only if they entered the federal territory before 29 March 2023; the same applies to a temporary residence permit granted according to Division 6 to the foreigner’s spouse and minor unmarried children.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Bans on entry and residence are to be issued for foreigners who have been expelled, removed or deported or who are subject to a deportation order according to section 58a. Bans on entry and residence are also to be issued for foreigners who have been refused entry because they attempted to enter the federal territory using forged or falsified documents. As a result of the ban on entry and residence, the foreigner is permitted neither to re-enter nor to stay in the federal territory or the territory of another member state of the European Union or another Schengen state, nor may the foreigner be granted a residence title, even if he or she is entitled to one under this Act. If the foreigner is allowed to enter and stay in another member state of the European Union or another Schengen state, the ban on entry and residence does not extend to that member state of the European Union or that Schengen state.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In the event of expulsion, a deportation order under section 58a or refusal of entry, a ban on entry and residence is to be issued together with the expulsion order, the deportation order under section 58a or the decision to refuse entry. In all other cases, the ban on entry and residence is to be issued, as a general rule, together with the deportation warning, the condition precedent being the deportation or removal, or at the latest at the time of deportation or removal. The length of the ban on entry and residence is to be set ex officio. The clock begins to run when the foreigner leaves the country or is refused entry. The length of the ban may be subject to conditions to prevent a threat to public safety and order, in particular requiring the foreigner to provide proof that he or she is not subject to prosecution or is not using illegal drugs. If the condition is not met before the ban expires, the ban is automatically extended at the time it would expire under sentence 5.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A discretionary decision is taken regarding the length of the time limit of the entry and residence ban. It may not exceed five years, except in cases covered by subsections (5) to (5b).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The ban on entry and residence may be revoked or shortened in order to uphold the legitimate interests of the foreigner, or if it is no longer required for the purpose for which it was imposed. As a general rule, the ban on entry and residence is to be revoked if the conditions for issuing a residence title pursuant to Chapter 2 Division 5 are met. When deciding whether the time limit of a residence and entry ban is to be shortened or whether the ban issued together with an expulsion order is to be revoked altogether, it is to be taken into account whether the foreigner met the obligation to leave the country within the period set for departure, unless the foreigner was prevented through no fault of his or her own from leaving or the period allowed for departure has been exceeded by an insignificant amount of time. The time limit of the entry and residence ban may be extended on the grounds of public safety and order. Subsection (3) applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, the length of the entry and residence ban is not to exceed 10 years if the foreigner was expelled on the ground of a criminal conviction or if the foreigner poses a serious threat to public safety and order. In these cases, subsection (4) applies accordingly. (5a) As a general rule, the time limit of the entry and residence ban is to be 20 years if the foreigner was expelled on the ground of a crime against peace, of a war crime or a crime against humanity or to avert a terrorist threat or a threat to the security of the Federal Republic of Germany or a terrorist threat. In these cases, subsection (4) sentences 4 and 5 applies accordingly. As a general rule, reducing the length of the entry and residence ban or revoking it altogether is prohibited. The supreme Land authority may permit exceptions to this rule in individual cases. (5b) If the foreigner is deported from the federal territory on the basis of a deportation order under section 58a, a permanent entry and residence ban is to be issued as a general rule. In the cases covered by subsection (5a) or where the foreigner has been expelled on the ground of an interest in expulsion under section 54 (1) no. 1, 2 or 2a, a permanent entry and residence ban may be issued in the individual case. Subsection (5a) sentences 3 and 4 applies accordingly. (5c) The authority which issues the expulsion order, the deportation warning or the deportation order pursuant to section 58a is also responsible for issuing the associated entry and residence ban and determining its length for the first time.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A ban on entry and residence may be issued for foreigners who have not fulfilled the obligation to leave the country within the period allowed for departure, unless they were prevented from leaving through no fault of their own or have exceeded the period allowed for departure by an insignificant amount of time. Subsection (1) sentence 2, subsection (2) sentences 3 to 6, subsection (3) sentence 1 and subsection (4) sentences 1, 2 and 4 apply accordingly. The ban on entry and residence is to be limited in time when it is ordered in accordance with sentence 1. As a general rule, the first time a ban on entry and residence is ordered in accordance with sentence 1, its length is not to exceed one year. In all other cases, its length is not to exceed three years, as a general rule. No ban on entry and residence is ordered where there are grounds for temporarily suspending deportation pursuant to section 60a for which the foreigner was not responsible.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees may issue a ban on entry and residence for a foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: whose asylum application was rejected as manifestly unfounded under section 29a (1) of the Asylum Act, who was not granted subsidiary protection, for whom the existence of the conditions for issuing a deportation ban under section 60 (5) or (7) was not established and who does not possess a residence title or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: whose application under section 71 or section 71a of the Asylum Act repeatedly did not lead to a follow-up asylum procedure. The ban on entry and residence takes effect when the decision on the application for asylum assumes legal validity. Subsection (1) sentences 3 and 4, subsection (2) sentences 3 to 6, subsection (3) sentence 1 and subsection (4) sentences 1, 2 and 4 apply accordingly. The ban on entry and residence is to be limited in time when it is ordered in accordance with sentence 1. As a general rule, the first time a ban on entry and residence is ordered in accordance with sentence 1, its length is not to exceed one year. In all other cases, its length is not to exceed three years, as a general rule. The competent foreigners authority decides on revoking, extending or shortening of the ban.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Before the ban on entry and residence expires, the foreigner may, by way of exception, be allowed to enter the federal territory for a brief period if the foreigner’s presence is required for compelling reasons or if denying permission would constitute undue hardship. The supreme Land authority is responsible for deciding in the cases covered covered by subsections (5a) and (5b).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If a foreigner enters the federal territory in contravention of a ban on entry and residence, the running of a fixed period is suspended during the foreigner’s stay in in the federal territory. The period may be extended in such cases, at the most, however, by the length of the original ban. The foreigner is to be informed of this possibility when the length of the ban is set for the first time. Subsections (3) and (4) sentence 1 apply accordingly to a ban extended in accordance with sentence 2.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The residence title is issued for the federal territory. Its validity in accordance with the provisions of the Convention Implementing the Schengen Agreement for residence in the territories of the contracting parties remains unaffected.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The visa and the temporary residence permit may be issued and extended subject to conditions. Conditions, in particular geographic restrictions, may also be imposed subsequently on visas and temporary residence permits. In particular, geographic restrictions may be imposed on temporary residence permits in cases where there is public interest in expelling the foreigner pursuant to section 54 (1) nos. 1 or 1a and where restrictions are necessary to remove the foreigner from an environment in which he or she is more likely to commit serious crimes.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner must immediately leave any part of the federal territory in which he or she may be staying without the permission of the foreigners authority in breach of a geographic restriction.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The residence of a foreigner who does not require a residence title may be made subject to time limits, geographic restrictions, conditions and requirements.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The foreigners authority may permit the foreigner to leave the geographic area to which he or she is restricted on the basis of this Act. This permission is to be granted if an urgent public interest applies, if it is necessary for compelling reasons or if denying permission would constitute undue hardship. The foreigner needs no permission for appointments at authorities or court hearings where his or her personal appearance is necessary.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In order to promote their lasting integration into the way of life in the Federal Republic of Germany, foreigners who have been granted asylum status, refugee status within the meaning of section 3 (1) of the Asylum Act, subsidiary protection status within the meaning of section 4 (1) of the Asylum Act or who have been granted a temporary residence permit for the first time pursuant to section 22, 23, section 24 (1) or section 25 (3) are required to take up their habitual residence (place of residence) in that Land to which they have been allocated for the purposes of their asylum procedure or in the context of their admission process or in accordance with section 24 (3) for a period of three years from the time such status or temporary residence was granted. Sentence 1 does not apply where a foreigner, the foreigner’s spouse, registered civil partner or a minor unmarried child who is related to the foreigner and lives in a family household with the foreigner takes up or has taken up employment of at least 15 hours per week with full social security coverage, on account of which that person has an income amounting to at least the average monthly needs for individual persons pursuant to sections 20 and 22 of Book Two of the Social Code, or that person takes up or has taken up vocational training or is pursuing studies or is in a training relationship, or takes up, has taken up or has completed an integration course as referred to in section 43, a vocational language course as referred to in section 45a, a training measure lasting at least three months which leads to the recognition of occupational qualifications, or a further training measure as referred to in sections 81 and 82 of Book Three of the Social Code, if the course or training measure cannot be completed or continued in the place of residence stipulated in sentence 1 without delay. The period referred to in sentence 1 may be extended by the period during which the foreigner fails to meet the obligations stipulated in sentence 1. Where the grounds set out in sentence 2 cease to exist within a period of three months, the obligation to take up residence in accordance with sentence 1 continues to apply in the Land to which the foreigner has moved his or her residence. (1a) As soon as a foreigner whose habitual residence is determined by a distribution or allocation decision pursuant to Book Eight of the Social Code comes of age, subsection (1) is applied; the foreigner is required to reside in the Land to which he or she was allocated most recently. The period of the foreigner’s residence in the allocated Land until coming of age and after being granted asylum status, refugee status within the meaning of section 3 (1) of the Asylum Act or subsidiary protection status within the meaning of section 4 (1) of the Asylum Act or after being granted a residence title for the first time pursuant to section 22, section 23, section 24 (1) or section 25 (3) is counted towards the period stipulated in subsection (1) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner who is subject to the obligation under subsection (1) and who is living in a reception centre or other temporary accommodation may, within six months of recognition, admission or the granting of a temporary residence permit under section 24(1), but no later than the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (1), be required, for the purpose of providing him or her with suitable accommodation, to take up residence in a specific place if this would not interfere with the foreigner’s lasting integration into the way of life in the Federal Republic of Germany. Insofar as it was not possible in an individual case to allocate suitable accommodation within six months, such allocation pursuant to sentence 1 may be made once within a further six months.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In order to promote their lasting integration into the way of life in the Federal Republic of Germany, foreigners who are subject to the obligation pursuant to subsection (1) may be required, within six months of being granted recognition or the or a temporary residence permit for the first time, but no later than the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (1), to take up residence in a specific place if this can help them

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: acquire suitable accommodation

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: acquire sufficient oral command of the German language equivalent to Level B1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: take up an economic activity, taking into account the local conditions in the vocational training and labour market. When taking decisions pursuant to sentence 1, specific local circumstances conducive to integration may also be taken into account, in particular the availability of educational and care services for minor children and juveniles.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Foreigners who are subject to the obligation under subsection (1) may, in order to prevent social exclusion, also be prohibited, until the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (1), from taking up residence in a specific place, in particular if it is to be expected that they will not use German as their main language of communication there. This decision is to take into account the situation of the local vocational training and labour market.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: An obligation imposed or allocation made pursuant to subsections (1) to (4) is to be revoked upon application by the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the foreigner furnishes proof, in the event of being required or allocated pursuant to subsections (1) to (3) to take up residence at another place, or in the event of being prohibited from taking up residence in a specific place pursuant to subsection (4), that

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner or the foreigner’s spouse, registered civil partner or minor unmarried child who is related to the foreigner and lives in a family household with him or her is in employment with full social security coverage within the meaning of subsection (1) sentence 2 has an income which secures most of the foreigner’s subsistence or a vocational training place or a place in higher education; or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: an integration course as referred to in section 43, a vocational language course as referred to in section 45a, a training measure lasting at least three months which leads to the recognition of occupational qualifications, or a further training measure as referred to in sections 81 and 82 of Book Three of the Social Code is available soon to the foreigner or the foreigner’s spouse, registered civil partner or minor unmarried child who is related to the foreigner and lives in a family household with him or her, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner’s spouse, registered civil partner or a minor unmarried child who is related to the foreigner and previously lived in a family household with him or her resides elsewhere,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: to prevent hardship; in particular, hardship exists where

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the competent youth welfare office estimates that the local child and youth welfare benefits and measures pursuant to Book Eight of the Social Code would be negatively affected,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: acceptance by another Land has been confirmed on other urgent, personal grounds or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: comparable unreasonable restrictions would arise for the person concerned on other grounds. Where the grounds for revocation set out in sentence 1 no. 1 (a) cease to exist within a period of three months of notification of revocation, the obligation to take up residence in accordance with subsection (1) sentence 1 continues to exist in the Land to which the foreigner has moved his or her residence. In the event of revocation under sentence 1 no. 2, the foreigner is to be subject to an obligation under subsection (3) or (4), at most until the period referred to in subsection (1) expires, account having been taken of the foreigner’s interests.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Where dependants subsequently immigrate to rejoin a foreigner who is subject to an obligation or allocation pursuant to subsections (1) to (4), the obligation or allocation also applies to the dependants subsequently immigrating at most until the period applicable to the foreigner referred to in subsection (1) expires, unless the competent authority has ordered otherwise. Subsection (5) applies accordingly to the subsequently immigrating dependants.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Subsections (1) to (6) do not apply to foreigners who were recognised or granted a temporary residence permit for the first time within the meaning of subsection (1) before 1 January 2016.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Objections and actions filed against obligations pursuant to subsections (2) to (4) have no suspensory effect.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: With regard to foreigners who are subject to the obligation pursuant to subsection (1), the Länder may, by way of statutory instruments of the Land government or other Land regulations, issue regulations specifying the organisation, procedure and suitable accommodation relating to

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: their distribution within the Land under subsection (2),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the procedure for making allocations and imposing obligations under subsections (2) to (4),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the requirements as to suitable accommodation within the meaning of subsections (2), (3) no. 1 and subsection (5) sentence 1 no. 1 (a), as well as the form of its proof,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the manner of furnishing proof of employment with full social security coverage under subsection (1) sentence 2, income which secures subsistence, and of having a vocational training place or a place in higher education within the meaning of subsections (1) and (5) sentence 1 no. 1 (a),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the obligation to be taken up by the municipality determined as the foreigner’s place of residence and the admission process.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In specially justified cases, section (12) (2) sentence 2 remains unaffected as regards conditions restricting the permissible geographic area of residence. Division 2 Entry

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Entry into and exit from the federal territory is permitted only at the approved border crossing points and within the stipulated traffic hours, unless exceptions are permitted on the basis of other statutory provisions or intergovernmental agreements. When entering or leaving the federal territory, foreigners are required to carry a recognised and valid passport or passport substitute as referred to in section 3 (1) and to submit to the police control of cross-border traffic.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is deemed to have entered the federal territory only after having crossed the border and passed through the border checkpoint. Should the authorities charged with policing cross-border traffic allow a foreigner to pass through the border checkpoint for a specific temporary purpose prior to a decision on the refusal of entry (section 15 of this Act, sections 18, 18a of the Asylum Act) or during preparation, safeguarding or implementation of this measure, this does not constitute entry as defined in sentence 1 as long as the said authorities remain able to monitor the foreigner’s stay. In all other cases, a foreigner is deemed to have entered the federal territory when crossing the border.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The entry of a foreigner into the federal territory is unlawful if the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: does not possess a passport or passport substitute as required in section 3 (1),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: does not possess the residence title as required in section 4, 2a.  does possess a visa required in section 4 upon entry, but obtained it by threat, bribery or collusion or by furnishing incorrect or incomplete information, for which reason it is revoked or annulled retrospectively, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: is not permitted to enter the federal territory in accordance with section 11 (1), (6) or (7) unless the foreigner possesses a temporary entry permit as required in section 11 (8).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The authorities charged with policing cross-border traffic may issue exceptional visa and passport substitutes.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner wishing to enter the federal territory unlawfully will be refused entry at the border.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner may be refused entry at the border if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: there is a public interest in expelling the foreigner,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: there is a well-founded suspicion that the foreigner does not intend to stay in the federal territory for the stated purpose, 2a.  the foreigner only possesses a Schengen visa or is exempted from the visa requirement for a short-term stay and intends to pursue an economic activity in breach of section 4a (1), sentence 2, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner does not fulfil the conditions for entry into the territory of the parties signatory in accordance with Article 6 of the Schengen Borders Code.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner who is exempted from the requirement to have a residence title for a temporary stay in the federal territory may be refused entry if the foreigner does not fulfil the requirements of section 3 (1) and section 5 (1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Section 60 (1) to (3), (5) and (7) to (9) applies accordingly. A foreigner who has filed an application for asylum may not be refused entry if the foreigner is permitted to stay in the federal territory in accordance with the provisions of the Asylum Act.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In order to ensure that a refusal of entry is effective where a ruling to refuse entry has been issued and cannot be enforced immediately, the foreigner concerned is, as a general rule, to be taken into custody (detention pending exit from the federal territory) by virtue of a judicial order. In all other cases, section 62 (4) applies accordingly. Subsection does not apply in cases in which the judge declines to issue a corresponding judicial order or to extend the period of detention.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Where the foreigner has reached the federal territory by air and has not entered the country as defined in section 13 but has been refused entry, the foreigner is to be taken to the transit area of an airport or to a place of accommodation from which he or she is able to leave the federal territory if detention pending exit from the federal territory is not applied for. The foreigner’s stay in the transit area of an airport or in accommodation pursuant to sentence 1 requires a judicial order no later than 30 days after the foreigner’s arrival at the airport or, if the time of arrival is impossible to ascertain, after the competent authorities become aware of the foreigner’s arrival. The judicial order is issued to ensure that the foreigner leaves the federal territory. It is permitted only where exit is to be expected within the term of the order. Subsection (5) applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: Foreigners who enter the country unlawfully without applying for asylum and who, when their unlawful entry has been detected, cannot be placed in custody pending deportation and deported or expelled directly from custody must be allocated to the Länder before deciding on the suspension of deportation or issuing a residence title. They are not entitled to be allocated to a specific Land or a specific town or location. Allocation to the Länder is carried out by a central allocation agency determined by the Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community. Unless another formula for allocation has been agreed among the Länder, the formula for the allocation of asylum applicants applies. Each Land appoints up to seven authorities to request allocation by the agency appointed in accordance with sentence 3 and to admit the allocated foreigners. If the foreigner furnishes evidence prior to allocation that a household community exists between spouses or parents and their minor children or that other compelling reasons exist which conflict with allocation to a certain place, this is given due consideration in the allocation process.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: The foreigners authorities may require foreigners to present themselves to the authority requesting allocation. This does not apply when due consideration is to be given to evidence submitted in accordance with subsection (1) sentence 6. An obligation imposed in accordance with sentence 1 is not contestable. Any legal actions have no suspensive effect.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: The central allocation agency informs the authority which has requested allocation which reception centre is obliged to admit the foreigners concerned in accordance with sentences 2 and 3. If the Land whose authority has requested allocation has not filled its admission quota, the Land’s reception centre located nearest to this authority having capacity is obliged to admit the foreigners concerned. Otherwise, the reception centre designated by the central allocation agency on the basis of the allocation quota pursuant to section 45 of the Asylum Act and the available accommodation capacities is obliged to admit the foreigners concerned. Section 46 (4) and (5) of the Asylum Act applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: In the cases covered by subsection (3) sentence 3 the authority which has requested allocation pursuant to subsection (3) orders the foreigner to report to the reception centre designated as a result of the allocation process; in the cases covered by subsection (3) sentence 2 it may issue such an order. The foreigners authority forwards the result of the interview to the authority requesting allocation, which notifies the central allocation agency of the number of foreigners, stating the countries of origin and the results of the interview. Spouses and parents and their minor unmarried children are registered and allocated as a group. The foreigner must stay at this reception centre until re-allocated to another location within the Land, but only until deportation has been suspended or a residence title has been issued; sections 12 and 61 (1) remain unaffected. The Land governments are authorised to regulate allocation within the Land by statutory instrument, unless allocation is regulated by Land law on the basis of this Act; section 50 (4) of the Asylum Act applies accordingly. The Land governments may delegate the said authorisation to other bodies of the Land. Orders pursuant to sentence 1 are not contestable. Any legal actions have no suspensive effect. Sentences 7 and 8 apply accordingly, if an allocation order is issued on the basis of a Land law or a statutory instrument pursuant to sentence 5.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: Following allocation, the competent authorities may permit the foreigner to take up residence in another Land. Following a permitted change of residence, the foreigner is deducted from the quota for the Land from which he is released and added to the quota for the receiving Land.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Allocation of foreigners who have entered the federal territory unlawfully
Text: The provisions of subsections (1) to (5) do not apply to persons who verifiably entered the federal territory prior to 1 January 2005. Division 3 Residence for educational purposes

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle underlying residence for educational purposes
Text: Giving foreigners access to education serves to promote general education, international understanding and meeting Germany’s demand for skilled labour. It also serves to promote Germany’s relations in the global scientific community and international development. Access to education is organised in a manner ensuring public security interests.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit for the purpose of basic and advanced in-company vocational training if the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that such basic and advanced vocational training is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency. During residence as referred to in sentence 1, no temporary residence permit may be granted for employment under section 19c (1) in conjunction with a provision of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners for temporary employment. Section 9 does not apply unless the foreigner possessed a temporary residence permit pursuant to section 18a or 18b before the temporary residence permit pursuant to sentence 1 was granted. The residence purpose of quality in-company vocational training as referred to in sentence 1 also comprises German language courses preparing participants for vocational training, in particular job-related German language training in line with the Ordinance on German Language Training (Deutschsprachförderverordnung).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, foreigners are to be granted a temporary residence permit for the purpose of school-based vocational training, if such training leads to a state-recognised vocational qualification as determined by federal or state provisions, unless the qualification pathway is primarily tailored to nationals of one specific country. Bi- or multilateral agreements of the Länder with public bodies in another country governing attendance of domestic schools by foreign school pupils remain unaffected. A temporary residence permit for the purpose of school attendance may only be issued on the basis of such agreements if the supreme Land authority responsible for residence law has endorsed the agreement. Subsection (1) sentences 2 and 3 applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The temporary residence permit only entitles the holder to pursue employment of up to 20 hours per week independent of the purpose referred to in subsection (1) or (2). As regards quality vocational training, foreigners are required to furnish proof that they have a sufficient command of the German language, if their command of the language required for the vocational training has not been tested by the educational institution and is not to be acquired in a preparatory German language course

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Before the temporary residence permit for the purpose of quality vocational training is withdrawn, revoked or its period of validity reduced retrospectively pursuant to section 7 (2) sentence 2, the foreigner is to be given the opportunity, for a period of up to six months, to find a place on another training course.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: For the purpose of full-time studies at a state or state-recognised university or a comparable educational institution, a foreigner is granted a temporary residence permit if he or she has been accepted by the educational institution. Residence for study purposes also extends to measures to prepare for studies and compulsory training. Measures to prepare for studies are

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: attending a language course to prepare for studies, if the foreigner has been accepted for full-time studies and the acceptance depends on the foreigner attending the preparatory language course, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: attending a preparatory or comparable course prior to studying, if the foreigner can prove that he or she has been accepted for the preparatory or comparable course. Proof of knowledge of the language needed for the specific course of studies is only required if the foreigner’s knowledge of the language has not been tested in the decision on acceptance and language acquisition is not the aim of the preparatory measures for the course of study.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The period of validity when the temporary residence permit for study purposes is granted for the first time and for each subsequent extension is, as a rule, two years and is not generally to be less than one year. The period of validity is at least two years if the foreigner takes part in Union or multilateral programmes that comprise mobility measures or if the foreigner is covered by an agreement between two or more higher education institutions. Where the course of study takes less than two years, the temporary residence permit is granted only for the duration of the course of study. The temporary residence permit is extended if the purpose of residence has not yet been achieved and is achievable within a reasonable period of time. The host educational institution may be consulted to find out whether the purpose of residence is still achievable.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In accordance with the following sentences, the temporary residence permit only entitles the holder to employment of up to a total of 140 working days per year (working day account). Student jobs are not counted. Part-time employment will be counted as follows in the way most favourable for the foreigner:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: every day on which the working time does not exceed four hours may be counted for the working day account as one-half working day, otherwise as a full working day, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: employment may be counted for the working day account per calendar week

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: during the semester, if a maximum of 20 hours per calendar week are worked, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: other than during the semester independent of how the working time is distributed, as two and one-half working days. The most favourable method as referred to in sentence 3 means determining for each calendar week whether the employment is counted according to sentence 3 no. 1 or no. 2.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: During residence as referred to in subsection (1), no temporary residence permit may be granted for employment under section 19c (1) in conjunction with a provision of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners for temporary employment. Section 9 does not apply.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner may be granted a temporary residence permit, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has been accepted by a state or state-recognised or comparable educational institution

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for full-time studies, with acceptance dependent on a condition which does not aim at attending measures to prepare for studies,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for full-time studies, with acceptance dependent on attending a preparatory or comparable course, but the foreigner is unable to furnish proof of being accepted for a preparatory or comparable course pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 3 no. 2 or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for part-time studies,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has been enrolled in a preparatory language course, without having been accepted for a course of study by a state or state-recognised university or a comparable educational institution, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has been accepted for a preparatory company traineeship. In the cases covered by sentence 1 no. 1, subsection (1) sentences 2 to 4 and subsections (2) to (4) apply accordingly. In the cases covered by sentence 1 nos. 2 and 3, subsections (2) to (4) are to be applied accordingly; in addition, the temporary residence permit allows holders to work as a trainee pursuant to sentence 1 no. 3.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Before the temporary residence permit under subsection (1) or (5) is withdrawn, revoked or its period of validity reduced pursuant to section 7 (2) sentence 2 for reasons which are beyond the foreigner’s control, the foreigner is to be given the opportunity, for a period of up to nine months, to apply for admission to another educational institution.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Foreigners who have been granted international protection status in another member state of the European Union are, as a general rule, to be granted a temporary residence permit for study purposes if they pursued studies in another EU member state for at least two years and the requirements of section 16c (1) sentence 1 nos. 2 and 3 apply. The temporary residence permit will be granted for the part of the studies to be carried out in Germany. Subsection (3) applies accordingly. Section 9 does not apply.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Subsections (1) to (4) and (6) serve to implement Directive 2016/801/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 May 2016 on the conditions of entry and residence of third-country nationals for the purposes of research, studies, training, voluntary service, pupil exchange schemes or educational projects and au pairing (OJ L 132, 21.5.2016, p. 21).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 4 (1), a foreigner does not require a residence title for stays for study purposes not exceeding 360 days, if the host educational institution in the federal territory has notified the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees and the competent authority of the other member state that the foreigner intends to carry out part of the studies in the federal territory, submitting the following to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees at the same time:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner has a residence title for study purposes from another member state of the European Union which is valid for the duration of the planned stay and falls within the scope of Directive 2016/801/EU,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner wishes to carry out part of the studies at an educational institution in the federal territory, because he or she is taking part in a Union or multilateral programme that comprises mobility measures or because he or she is covered by an agreement between two or more higher education institutions.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner has been accepted by the host educational institution,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a copy of the foreigner’s recognised and valid passport or passport substitute, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: and evidence that the foreigner’s subsistence is secure. The host educational institution must notify the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees when the foreigner applies for a residence title in the scope of Directive 2016/801/EU in another member state of the European Union. If, at the time of application, the host educational institution is not yet aware of the foreigner’s intention to carry out part of the studies in the federal territory, it is to notify the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees as soon as it becomes aware of this intention. If the residence title pursuant to sentence 1 no. 1 has been issued by a non-Schengen state, and if the foreigner enters the federal territory via a non-Schengen state, the foreigner must carry a copy of the notification and present it to the responsible authorities at their request.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 2 and if the foreigner is not denied entry and residence in accordance with section 19f (5), the foreigner may enter the federal territory at any time during the validity of the residence title issued by another member state as referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 and stay there to study. If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 3 and if the foreigner was not denied entry and residence in accordance with section 19f (5), the foreigner may enter the federal territory and stay there to study. During the stay referred to in subsection (1), section 16b (3) applies subject to the proviso that if the foreigner’s stay is less than 360 days, the foreigner is only entitled to take up employment for a reduced number of days in the same proportion to the stay as allowed by the working day account.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If a foreigner is denied entry and residence under section 19f (5), the foreigner must cease the studies immediately. The exemption from the obligation to hold a residence title which applied in accordance with subsection (1) sentence 1 ceases to exist.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If, within 30 days of receipt of the notification referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1, the foreigner has not been denied entry and residence in line with section 19f (5), the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees is to issue the foreigner with a certificate confirming the entitlement to enter and stay in the federal territory to study as part of short-term mobility.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Once a foreigner has been denied entry and residence under section 19f (5) or the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees has issued a certificate within the meaning of subsection (4), responsibility for further measures and decisions under residence law rests with the foreigners authority, as set out in section 71 (1). (3) The foreigner and the host educational institution are required to inform the foreigners authority of any changes to the requirements stipulated in subsection (1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: For the purpose of recognising occupational qualifications which a foreigner has acquired abroad, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit to undertake a qualification measure and to take a subsequent examination, if a body responsible according to federal or Länder regulations regarding recognition of occupational qualifications has determined that adaptation or compensation measures or further qualifications are necessary

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: to establish the equivalence of the occupational qualification with a German occupational qualification or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: to grant authorisation to work in an occupation which is regulated in Germany. The granting of a temporary residence permit is subject to the following conditions:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner has a command of the German language necessary for the qualification measure; as a rule that is at least an elementary knowledge of the German language,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the qualification measure is suited to enabling recognition of the foreigner’s occupational qualification or access to the occupation, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: in the case of primarily in-company training, the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that participating in the qualification measure is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency. The temporary residence permit is issued for a period of up to 24 months and is extended by a maximum of 12 months, to add up to a maximum period of residence of three years. It only entitles the holder to pursue employment which is independent of the qualification measure for up to 20 hours per week.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: The temporary residence permit referred to in subsection (1) also entitles the holder to pursue employment which is not restricted in terms of time and whose requirements are connected to the specialist skills needed in the later employment if the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners that such employment is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency. Section 18 (2) no. 3 applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: As a general rule, foreigners are to be granted a temporary residence permit to work in skilled employment while waiting for their vocational qualification acquired abroad to be recognised, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: has a foreign occupational qualification which is officially recognised by the country where it was acquired and which can only be acquired after completing training which takes at least two years, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: holds a foreign higher education qualification which is officially recognised in the country where it was acquired, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner has a concrete job offer,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the agreement to be concluded between the foreigner and the employer states that

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner agrees to initiate, immediately after entering Germany at the latest, the procedure for recognising the foreign occupational qualification with the body responsible according to federal or Länder regulations for the recognition of occupational qualifications, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the employer agrees to enable the foreigner to undertake, as part of the employment relationship, the qualification measures required by the responsible body to recognise the foreigner’s occupational qualification,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the employer is a suitable provider of initial or subsequent training,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner has a command of the German language necessary for the envisaged employment, or at least an elementary knowledge of the German language, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that such employment is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency. The requirement of skilled employment as referred to in sentence 1 is to be waived if an authorisation is needed for this employment and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the employer is bound by a collective agreement, or the employer is a religious organisation bound by the regulations of committees with equal representation which determine terms of employment based on church law,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the employer employs the foreigner according to the terms of employment of the applicable collective agreement or the terms of employment determined on the basis of church law, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the classification and the pay are commensurate to employment whose requirements lead to work in the desired occupation. The requirement of skilled employment as referred to in sentence 1 is to be waived as well if an authorisation is needed for this employment and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the employer is a licensed health-care facility according to section 72 of Book Eleven of the Social Code, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the classification and the pay are commensurate to employment whose requirements lead to work in the desired occupation. The foreigner is required to to obtain confirmation from a competent German authority that the foreigner fulfils the prerequisites of sentence 1 no. 1 (a) or (b). The temporary residence permit is granted for the first time for the length of time approved by the Federal Employment Agency but no longer than one year, and is extended up to a maximum period of residence of three years. After the maximum period of the temporary residence permit has expired, no residence permit may be granted pursuant to sections 16d and 19c (1) in conjunction with a provision of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners for temporary employment. Section 9 does not apply. The temporary residence permit only entitles the holder to pursue employment under sentence 1, 2 or 3 no. 2 and to secondary employment of up to 20 hours per week.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: As a general rule, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit for a year to have the occupational qualification acquired abroad recognised and the permit is to be extended by 12 months up to a maximum period of residence of three years, if the foreigner, on the basis of an agreement between the Federal Employment Agency and the employment administration of the foreigner’s country of origin, has been placed in a job

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: using the procedure, selection, placement and the process to establish the equivalence of the occupational qualification with a German occupational qualification and to grant the authorisation to work in occupations in the health and care sector regulated by federal or Land law, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: using the procedure, selection, placement and the process to establish the equivalence of the occupational qualification with a German occupational qualification and, where necessary, to grant the authorisation to work in other specific occupations, taking into account the adequacy of the training structures in the country of origin and the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that granting a temporary residence permit is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency. Moreover, foreigners must have the command of the German language laid down in the agreement; as a general rule that is an elementary knowledge of the German language. The temporary residence permit only entitles the holder to pursue employment which is independent of the occupational qualification to be recognised for up to 20 hours per week.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: As a general rule, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit in order to take an examination for the recognition of a foreign occupational qualification, if the foreigner has the necessary command of the German language for the examination, as a rule at least an elementary knowledge of the German language, unless the examination is intended to demonstrate a command of the German language. The residence permit does not entitle the holder to pursue an economic activity.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: As a general rule, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit for up to six months in order to determine whether he or she has the relevant occupational skills, knowledge and abilities needed to establish the equivalence of the vocational qualification acquired abroad (analysis of qualifications) and which qualify him or her to work in a skilled occupation. The granting of a temporary residence permit is subject to the following conditions:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the competent authority has decided that the legal requirements for a different procedure to establish the equivalence of the vocational qualification acquired abroad are met and carrying out an analysis of qualifications has been approved,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications
Text: the foreigner has a command of the German language corresponding to the analysis of qualifications to be carried out, as a rule at least an elementary knowledge of the German language. Subsection (1) sentence 4 and subsection (2) apply accordingly. If the competent authority determines, after completing the procedure, that adaptation or compensation measures are necessary, the foreigner’s residence under subsection (1) or subsection (3) may continue provided the requirements specified there are met. The length of residence referred to in sentence 1 is not counted as part of the maximum period of residence referred to in subsection (1) and subsection (3).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner may be issued with a temporary residence permit for training purposes in accordance with Directive 2016/801/EU, if the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined by the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that such training is permissible without approval from the Federal Employment Agency, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the training programme is designed to enable the foreigner to gain knowledge, practice and experience in a work environment,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the foreigner presents a training agreement which provides for theoretical and practical training with a host entity and contains the following:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a description of the training programme, including the educational objective or learning components,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the duration of the training programme,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the conditions under which the foreigner will work and be supervised,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the working hours and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the legal relationship between the foreigner and the host entity,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the foreigner provides evidence of having obtained a higher education degree within the two years preceding the date of application or of pursuing a course of study that leads to a higher education degree,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the training is equivalent to the higher education degree or studies referred to in no. 3, in terms of both content and level, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: if the host entity has undertaken in writing to bear the costs incurred by public bodies up to six months after termination of the training agreement for

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner’s subsistence during an unlawful stay in the federal territory, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: deportation of the foreigner.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The temporary residence permit is issued for the agreed duration of training, but not to exceed six months.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner may be granted a temporary residence permit to attend language courses which do not serve to prepare for a course of study or to participate in a pupil exchange scheme. A temporary residence permit for participation in a pupil exchange scheme may also be granted in cases where there is no direct exchange.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, a foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit to attend school as of grade nine, provided it is guaranteed that the school class comprises pupils of various nationalities and that the school

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: is a state or state-recognised school with an international orientation or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: is a school which is not or not primarily funded from public funds and prepares pupils for international qualifications, qualifications issued by other countries or state-recognised qualifications.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, while foreigners are residing in Germany to attend school under subsection (2), they are to be granted a temporary residence permit for another purpose only if they are legally entitled to it. After staying in Germany to take part in a pupil exchange scheme foreign pupils may only be granted a temporary residence permit for another purpose if they are legally entitled to it. Section 9 does not apply. The temporary residence permit under subsection (1) to attend a language course only entitles the foreigner to pursue employment of up to 20 hours per week. The temporary residence permit under subsection (1) to participate in a pupil exchange scheme and the temporary residence permit under subsection (2) do not entitle holders to pursue an economic activity.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Bi- or multi-lateral agreements of the Länder with public bodies in another country governing attendance of domestic schools by foreign pupils remain unaffected. A temporary residence permit to attend school can only be issued on the basis of such agreements if the supreme Land authority responsible for residence law has endorsed the agreement.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: A foreigner is to be granted a temporary residence permit if he or she

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: is an asylum applicant in Germany who

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: has started quality vocational training in a state-recognised or similarly regulated occupation, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: has started training as an assistant or helper in a state-recognised or similarly regulated occupation which may lead to quality vocational training in a state-recognised or similarly regulated occupation in which the Federal Employment Agency has determined that a labour shortage exists, and has been granted a training place, and would like to continue this training after the application for asylum has been denied, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: has been granted a temporary suspension of deportation under section 60a and starts training as referred to in no. 1. In cases of obvious fraud, the temporary residence permit may be denied.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) will not be granted if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: any of the conditions listed in section 60a (6) apply,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: in the case of subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2, the foreigner has not yet possessed a temporary suspension of deportation for three months at the time of applying,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the foreigner’s identity was not verified
