ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: before applying for a temporary residence permit, and the foreigner entered the federal territory by 31 December 2016, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: before applying for a temporary residence permit or by 30 June 2020 at the latest, and the foreigner entered the federal territory after 1 January 2017 and before 1 January 2020, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: during the first six months after entry, if the foreigner entered the federal territory after 31 December 2019; the foreigner will be deemed to have met the deadline if he or she took all necessary and reasonable measures to verify his or her identity within the time periods given in (a) to (c), but his or her identity was unable to be verified until after these periods for reasons beyond the foreigner’s control,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: any of the conditions listed in section 19d (1) no. 6 or 7 applies, or the foreigner is subject to an expulsion order or a deportation order pursuant to section 58a, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: in the case of subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2, at the time of application concrete measures to terminate residence are imminent which are close enough to the termination of residence in terms of content and timing; such concrete measures to terminate residence are imminent if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: a medical examination to determine the ability to travel has been carried out,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the foreigner has applied for government funds to assist with voluntary departure,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the process of booking transport for the deportation has been initiated,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: similar concrete preparations to deport the foreigner have been initiated, unless it is foreseeable from the outset that such measures will be unsuccessful, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the process for determining the member state responsible in accordance with Article 20 (1) of Regulation (EU) No 604/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 June 2013 (OJ L 180, 29.6.2019, p. 31) has been initiated.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: An application for a temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) may be made no earlier than seven months before the vocational training begins. A temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2 is granted no earlier than six months before the vocational training begins. It is granted if, at the time of application for a residence permit pursuant to subsection (1),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the entry of the training contract in the list of vocational training relationships at the responsible body has been applied for,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: the training contract has been entered in the list of vocational training relationships at the responsible body,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: if such entry is not necessary, the training contract was concluded with an educational institution, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: a state or state-recognised educational institution has approved the training contract. The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) is granted for the duration of vocational training as specified in the training contract. (3a) The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) only entitles the holder to pursue employment of up to 20 hours per week independent of the purpose referred to in subsection (1) for the duration of vocational training as specified in subsection (1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: If the training ends earlier than planned or is discontinued, the educational institution is required to notify the competent foreigners authority immediately, generally within two weeks, in written or electronic form. The notification is to include the facts to be notified and when they arose, as well as the surnames, given names and the nationality of the foreigner.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: If the training relationship ends earlier than planned or is discontinued, the temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) is extended one time for six months for the purpose of seeking another training place in order to begin vocational training in accordance with subsection (1). The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) is granted for six months for the purpose of seeking employment commensurate with the acquired vocational qualification if, after successfully completing the vocational training for which the temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) was granted, the foreigner is not kept on in the training enterprise; the temporary residence permit referred to sentence 1 or 2 granted to enable the foreigner to seek employment or training may not be extended for this purpose.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: A temporary residence permit as referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 may be granted without regard to subsection (2) no. 3 if the foreigner has taken the necessary and reasonable measures to verify his or her identity.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) or subsection (5) is revoked if any of the conditions listed in subsection (2) no. 4 occurs or if the training ends earlier than planned or is discontinued.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: After the vocational training has been completed successfully, a temporary residence permit for two years is to be granted for employment commensurate to the vocational qualification acquired with approval from the Federal Employment Agency if the requirements of section 19d (1) nos. 2, 3, 6 and 7 are met. The residence permit entitles the holder to take up any employment after he or she has been in an employed position commensurate with his or her vocational qualification for a period of two years.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: A temporary residence permit issued pursuant to subsection (8) is revoked if the employment relationship on which the granting of the temporary residence permit was based is terminated for reasons relating to the person of the foreigner or if any of the conditions listed in subsection (2) no. 4 occurs.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for vocational training by foreigners who are required to leave the country
Text: The temporary residence permit is granted in derogation from section 5 (2) and section 10 (3) sentence 1. Section 5 no. 1a does not apply. For as long as the foreigner receives educational and training assistance in accordance with Book Three of the Social Code, claiming pubic benefits for the purpose of ensuring his or her subsistence does not preclude the granting of the temporary residence permit. The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) in conjunction with subsection (5) is granted in derogation from section 5 (1) no. 1. Section 3 may be disregarded in the cases referred to in subsection (6).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: A foreigner may be granted a temporary residence permit to seek a training place in order to pursue quality vocational training, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner is not yet 35 years of age,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner’s subsistence is secure;

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner has a school-leaving certificate issued by a German school abroad or a school-leaving certificate entitling the holder to access to higher education in the federal territory or in the country where the school-leaving certificate was acquired, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner has a sufficient command of the German language. The temporary residence permit is granted for up to nine months. It may only be issued anew if the foreigner, after leaving Germany, stayed abroad for at least as long as he or she stayed in the federal territory on the basis of a temporary residence permit pursuant to sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: A foreigner may be issued a temporary residence permit for the purpose of applying for a course of study, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner meets the educational and linguistic requirements to take up a course of study or if they are to be met within the period of residence under sentence 2, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: the foreigner’s subsistence is secure. The temporary residence permit is granted for up to nine months.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Seeking a vocational training place or a place in higher education
Text: The temporary residence permit pursuant to subsections (1) and (2) only entitles the foreigner to pursue employment of up to 20 hours per week and to pursue probationary employment for up to two weeks. As a general rule, foreigners staying in Germany pursuant to subsections (1) and (2) are to be granted a temporary residence permit for another purpose of residence only in accordance with sections 16a, 16b or 19c (2) or if they are legally entitled to one. Division 4 Residence for the purpose of economic activity

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: The admission of foreign employees is geared to the requirements associated with making Germany an attractive place to conduct business and research, giving due consideration to the labour market situation. The opportunities given to foreign workers and skilled workers serve to guarantee the supply of labour and to strengthen the social security systems. They are intended to promote the lasting integration of skilled workers and experienced workers in society and the labour market, with due consideration of public security interests.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: A residence title to take up employment is granted subject to the following conditions:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: the foreigner has a concrete job offer,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: the Federal Employment Agency has given its approval under section 39; this does not apply if it has been determined by law, intergovernmental agreement or pursuant to the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners that employment is permissible without the approval of the Federal Employment Agency; in this case, the residence title may also be denied if one of the conditions stipulated in section 40 (2) or (3) exists,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: the authorisation to work in the occupation has been granted or promised, if necessary,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: the equivalence of the qualification has been established or the foreigner has a foreign higher education qualification which is recognised or otherwise comparable to a German higher education qualification to the extent that this is a condition for being granted the residence title, 4a.  the foreigner and the employer provide assurances that the job will in fact be performed, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: where a foreigner who is 45 years of age or older and has been granted a residence title for the first time under sections 18a or 18b, has a salary corresponding to at least 55 per cent of the annual earnings ceiling of the general pension scheme, unless the foreigner can prove that he or she possesses adequate provision for old age. The conditions of sentence 1 may be waived if there is a public interest, and in particular a regional, economic or labour market interest in the foreigner’s employment, in particular if the salary is only slightly below the minimum level or the foreigner’s age is only slightly above the age limit. The Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community announces the minimum salaries in the Federal Gazette annually by 31 December for the following calendar year.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: For the purposes of this Act, a skilled worker means a foreigner who

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: has successfully completed quality vocational training in Germany or has a foreign quality vocational qualification which is equivalent to one acquired in Germany (skilled worker with vocational training qualification), or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: has a German higher education qualification, a recognised foreign higher education qualification or a foreign higher education qualification comparable to a German one (skilled worker holding a higher education qualification).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Principle of skilled immigration; general provisions
Text: Residence titles under sections 18a, 18b, 18g and 19c are granted for a period of four years or for a shorter period plus an additional three months, but not to exceed four years, if the employment relationship or the approval by the Federal Employment Agency is limited to a shorter period.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Skilled workers with a vocational training qualification
Text: Skilled workers with a vocational training qualification are granted a temporary residence permit to take up any skilled employment.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Skilled workers holding a university degree
Text: Skilled workers with a university degree are granted a temporary residence permit to take up any skilled employment.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: Skilled workers are to be granted a permanent settlement permit without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: they have held a residence title pursuant to sections 18a, 18b, 18d or 18g for three years,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: they have a job in compliance with the requirements stipulated in sections 18a, 18b,18d or 18g,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: they have paid compulsory or voluntary contributions into the statutory pension insurance scheme for at least 36 months or furnish evidence of an entitlement to comparable benefits from an insurance or pension scheme or from an insurance company, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: they have a sufficient command of the German language, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: the requirements of section 9 (2) sentence 1 nos. 2, and 4 to 6, 8 and 9 are met; section 9 (2) sentences 2 to 4 and 6 applies accordingly. The period stipulated in sentence 1 no. 1 is reduced to two years and the period stipulated in sentence 1 no. 3 is reduced to 24 months if the skilled worker has successfully completed vocational training or a course of study in Germany.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: In derogation from subsection (1), holders of an EU Blue Card are to be granted a permanent settlement permit if they have been employed in accordance with section 18g for at least 27 months and have paid mandatory or voluntary contributions to the statutory pension insurance scheme for that period, or if they furnish evidence of an entitlement to comparable benefits from an insurance or pension scheme or from an insurance company and if the requirements of section 9 (2) sentence 1 nos. 2 and 4 to 6, 8 and 9 are met and if they have basic German language skills. Section 9 (2) sentences 2 to 4 and 6 applies accordingly. The period referred to in sentence 1 is reduced to 21 months if the foreigner has a sufficient command of the German language.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: As a general rule, a highly skilled worker holding a university degree is to be granted a permanent settlement permit in special cases without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency if there is reason to assume that integration into the way of life in the Federal Republic of Germany and the foreigner's subsistence without state assistance are assured and if the requirements of section 9 (2) sentence 1 no. 4 are met. The Land government may stipulate that granting the permanent settlement permit pursuant to sentence 1 requires the approval of the supreme Land authority or a body designated by it. Highly skilled workers as referred to in sentence 1 include in particular the following persons, provided that they have multiple years of work experience:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: scientists with special technical knowledge or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Permanent settlement permit for skilled workers
Text: teaching personnel in prominent positions or scientific personnel in prominent positions.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is granted a temporary residence permit for research purposes in accordance with Directive 2016/801/EU without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: has concluded an effective hosting agreement or an equivalent contract to carry out a research project with a research organisation which is recognised for the implementation of the special approval procedure for researchers in the federal territory, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: has concluded an effective hosting agreement or an equivalent contract with a research organisation which conducts research, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the research organisation has undertaken in writing to bear the costs incurred by public bodies up to six months after termination of the hosting agreement for

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner’s subsistence during an unlawful stay in a member state of the European Union, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: deporting the foreigner. In the cases covered by sentence 1 no. 1 (a) the temporary residence permit is to be granted within 60 days of the application being made.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: As a general rule, the requirement stipulated in subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2 is to be waived if the activities of the research organisation are financed primarily from public funds. The requirement may be waived where there is a special public interest in the research project. Section 66 (5), section 67 (3) and section 68 (2) sentences 2 and 3 and subsection (4) apply accordingly to the declarations furnished pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The research organisation may also submit the declaration pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 2 to the body responsible for its recognition as a general declaration for all foreigners to whom a temporary residence permit is issued on the basis of a hosting agreement concluded with it.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The temporary residence permit is granted for at least one year. If the foreigner takes part in a Union or multilateral programme that comprises mobility measures, the temporary residence permit is granted for at least two years. By way of derogation from sentences 1 and 2, where the research project is completed in a shorter period, the term of the temporary residence permit is limited to the duration of the research project; in the cases covered by sentence 2, the period is at least one year.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A temporary residence permit pursuant to subsection (1) entitles the holder to take up research at the research organisation specified in the hosting agreement and to take up teaching activities. Changes to the research project during the stay do not cause this entitlement to expire.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner who has international protection status in a member state of the European Union may be granted a temporary residence permit for research purposes, if the requirements of subsection (1) are met and the foreigner has stayed in this member state for at least two years after being granted protection. Subsection (5) applies accordingly.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 4 (1), a foreigner does not require a residence title for stays for research purposes not exceeding 180 days in a 360-day period, if the host research organisation in the federal territory has notified the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees and the competent authority of the other member state that the foreigner intends to carry out part of the research in the federal territory, submitting the following to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees at the same time:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner possesses a valid residence title for research purposes issued by another member state in accordance with Directive 2016/801/EU,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the hosting agreement or an equivalent contract concluded with the host research organisation in the federal territory,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a copy of the foreigner’s recognised and valid passport or passport substitute, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner’s subsistence is secure. The host research organisation is to make the notification when the foreigner applies for a residence title in the scope of Directive 2016/801/EU in another member state of the European Union. If, at the time of application, the host research organisation is not yet aware of the foreigner’s intention to carry out part of the research in the federal territory, it must make the notification as soon as it becomes aware of this intention. If the residence title pursuant to sentence 1 no. 1 has been issued by a non-Schengen state, and if the foreigner enters the federal territory via a non-Schengen state, the foreigner must carry a copy of the notification and present it to the competent authorities at their request.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 2, and if the foreigner has not been denied entry and residence under section 19f (5), the foreigner may enter the federal territory at any time during the validity of the residence title and stay there for research purposes. If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 3, the foreigner may enter the federal territory at any time after the notification is received and during the validity of the residence title issued by the other member state as referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 and stay there for research purposes.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Foreigners who fulfil the requirements stipulated in subsection (1) are entitled to take up research in the host research organisation and to take up teaching activities.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If a foreigner is denied entry and residence pursuant to section 19f (5), the foreigner must cease the research activities immediately. The exemption from the obligation to hold a residence title under subsection (1) sentence 1 ceases to exist.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If the foreigner is not denied entry and residence in line with section 19f (5), the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees issues the foreigner with a certificate confirming the entitlement to enter and stay in the federal territory for research purposes as part of short-term mobility.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Once a foreigner has been denied entry and residence under section 19f (5) or the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees has issued a certificate within the meaning of subsection (5), responsibility for further measures and decisions under residence law rests with the foreigners authority, as set out in section 71 (1). (4) The foreigner and the host research organisation are required to inform the foreigners authority of any changes to the requirements stipulated in subsection (1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: Foreigners are granted a temporary residence permit without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency for stays for research purposes which last more than 180 days but no more than one year, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: the foreigner holds a residence title issued by another member state in accordance with Directive 2016/801/EU for the duration of the procedure,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: a copy of the foreigner’s recognised and valid passport or passport substitute is submitted, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: the hosting agreement or an equivalent contract concluded with the host research organisation in the federal territory is submitted.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: If the application for a temporary residence permit is filed at least 30 days prior to the beginning of the stay in the federal territory and if the residence title issued by the other member state continues to be valid, the foreigner’s residence and economic activity is permitted for up to 180 days in a 360-day period until the foreigners authority decides on the application.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: Section 18d (5) applies accordingly to the entitlement to take up research and teaching activities.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: The foreigner and the host research organisation are required to inform the foreigners authority of any changes to the requirements stipulated in subsection (1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for mobile researchers
Text: The application will be rejected if it was filed at the same time as a notification under section 18e (1) sentence 1. Applications which were filed during the stay pursuant to section 18e (1), but not in their entirety at least 30 days prior to the end of this stay, will also be rejected.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Skilled workers holding a university degree are granted an EU Blue Card without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency for employment in Germany commensurate with their qualification, if they have a salary corresponding to at least 50 per cent of the annual earnings ceiling of the general pension scheme and if none of the reasons for refusal regulated in section 19f (1) and (2) exist. Skilled workers holding a university degree who

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: are employed in occupations which belong to the groups 132, 133, 134, 21, 221, 222, 225, 226, 23 or 25 according to the Commission Recommendation of 29 October 2009 on the use of the International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO-08) (OJ L 292, 10.11.2009, p. 31) or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: have obtained a higher education qualification no more than three years prior to applying for an EU Blue Card, are granted an EU Blue Card in derogation from sentence 1 with the approval of the Federal Employment Agency if their salary is at least 45.3 per cent of the annual earnings ceiling of the general pension scheme. The requirements of section 18 (2) no. 3 are deemed to have been met if the skilled worker holds a temporary residence permit pursuant to section 18b and the same authorisation to work in an occupation is required for employment in the occupation with the EU Blue Card as for the temporary residence permit pursuant to section 18b. The requirements of section 18 (2) no. 4 are deemed to have been met if the skilled worker holds a temporary residence permit pursuant to section 18b and presented the same higher education qualification to be granted the residence permit that is required for the EU Blue Card. Sentences 1 to 4 apply accordingly to skilled workers who have successfully completed a programme of tertiary education which is equivalent to a higher education degree and takes at least three years of training to complete, if this qualification corresponds to the level of training that in the Federal Republic of Germany is classified as at least Level 6 of the International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED 2011) or Level 6 of the European Qualifications Framework.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 18 (2) no. 4, a foreigner who does not meet the requirements of subsection (1) is granted an EU Blue Card with the approval of the Federal Employment Office for the purpose of employment in Germany in an occupation commensurate to his or her qualifications which belongs to Group 133 or 25 according to the Commission Recommendation of 29 October 2009 on the use of the International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO-08) (OJ L 292, 10.11.2009, p. 31) if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: their salary is at least 45.3 per cent of the annual earnings ceiling of the general pension scheme,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: none of the grounds for rejection referred to in section 19f (1) and (2) applies, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has skills, knowledge and abilities

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: based on at least three years of occupational experience gained within the past seven years in an occupation which belongs to Group 133 or 25 according to the Commission Recommendation of 29 October 2009 on the use of the International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO-08) (OJ L 292, 10.11.2009, p. 31),

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: at a level which is comparable to a higher education qualification or qualification from a tertiary programme of education which is equivalent to higher education studies and fulfils all the requirements of subsection (1) sentence 5, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: required for employment in the occupation.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Granting an EU Blue Card requires that the concrete job offer under section 18 (2) no. 1 provides for employment of at least six months.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 4a (3) sentence 4, a holder of an EU Blue Card does not need the permission of the foreigners authority to change jobs. During the first 12 months of employment, the competent foreigners authority may suspend all job changes by a holder of an EU Blue Card for 30 days and refuse job changes within this period if, following the job change, the requirements for granting an EU Blue Card are no longer met.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: For the purpose of granting an EU Blue Card, the subsistence of a foreigner is deemed to be secure if the foreigner possesses a temporary residence permit in accordance with section 18a or 18b and does not change jobs.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 8 (1), the minimum salary level referred to in subsection (1) sentence 2 applies when extending an EU Blue Card if the applicant acquired a higher education qualification or qualification from a tertiary programme of education which is equivalent to higher education studies no more than three years prior to applying for the extension of the EU Blue Card, or if fewer than 24 months have elapsed since the first EU Blue Card was granted in accordance with subsection (1) sentence 2 no. 2. In all other cases, section 8 (1) remains unaffected.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The Federal Ministry of the Interior and Community announces the minimum salaries referred to in subsections (1) and (2) in the Federal Gazette for each calendar year by 31 December for the following year.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Short-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: In derogation from section 4 (1), holders of a valid EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union do not need a residence title or a work permit from the Federal Employment Agency to enter and stay for the purpose of conducting business activities which are directly related to their obligations stated in the work contract on the basis of which the EU Blue Card was granted if their stay does not exceed 90 days within a 180-day period. If the EU Blue Card was issued by a member state of the European Union that is not a Schengen state, in addition to the EU Blue Card, the foreigner must have evidence of the business purpose of the stay and present it on request during the border check.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Short-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: Subsection (1) applies accordingly if the foreigner has the legal status of a long-term resident in another member state of the European Union and immediately before acquiring this status possessed an EU Blue Card issued by that member state.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Long-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: A foreigner who possesses a valid EU Blue Card granted by another member state of the European Union and has legally resided in that member state for at least 12 months by virtue of that EU Blue Card is granted an EU Blue Card pursuant to section 18g if the requirements of section 18g are met. The requirement stipulated in section 18 (2) no. 4 is deemed to be met unless

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Long-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: the foreigner has possessed the EU Blue Card issued by the other member state of the European Union for less than two years, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Long-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: the other member state of the European Union granted the EU Blue Card on the basis of skills, knowledge and abilities gained from professional experience for the purpose of employment in an occupation which is not listed in Annex I of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 October 2021 on the conditions of entry and residence of third-country nationals for the purpose of highly qualified employment, and repealing Council Directive 2009/50/EC (OJ L 382, 28.10.2021, p. 1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Long-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: If a member state of the European Union which is not a Schengen state issued the EU Blue Card in accordance with subsection (1) sentence 1 first half-sentence, in addition to the valid EU Blue Card, the foreigner must have a work contract or a binding job offer commensurate with his or her qualification at the level of a higher education qualification or a qualification from a tertiary programme of education which is equivalent to higher education studies which meets all the requirements of section 18g (1) sentence 5 and must keep the work contract or binding offer with him or her for at least six months in the federal territory.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Long-term mobility for holders of an EU Blue Card
Text: If the foreigner has already made use of the option of long-term mobility pursuant to Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 one or more times, the minimum length of legal residence in another member state of the European Union using a valid EU Blue Card issued by that member state is, in derogation from subsection (1) sentence 1, six months.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: An ICT Card is a residence title for the purpose of an intra-corporate transfer of a foreigner. An intra-corporate transfer is the temporary secondment of a foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: to a national entity belonging to the undertaking by which the foreigner is employed, if the undertaking is located outside the European Union, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: to a national entity of another undertaking of the group of undertakings to which the undertaking located outside the European Union belongs and by which the foreigner is employed.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is granted an ICT Card if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner will work as a manager or specialist in the host entity,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has been employed by the undertaking or group of undertakings for at least six months immediately prior to the transfer and will be employed without interruption by the undertaking or group of undertakings during the transfer period,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the intra-corporate transfer will exceed 90 days,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner provides a work contract valid for the duration of the intra-corporate transfer and, if necessary, an assignment letter stating

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: specific information regarding the place and kind of work, remuneration and other terms and conditions of employment during the intra-corporate transfer, as well as

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner will be able to return to an entity belonging to the same undertaking or group of undertakings established outside the European Union after completing the intra-corporate transfer, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner provides evidence of his or her occupational qualifications. A manager within the meaning of this Act is a person holding a senior position, who primarily directs the management of the host entity, receiving general supervision or guidance principally from the board of directors or shareholders of the business or equivalent. This position includes directing the host entity or a department or subdivision of the host entity; supervising and monitoring work of the other supervisory, professional or managerial employees; and having the authority to recommend hiring, dismissing or other personnel action. A specialist within the meaning of this Act is a person who possesses specialised knowledge essential to the host entity's areas of activity, techniques or management, a high level of qualification and appropriate professional experience.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is granted an ICT Card also if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner will work as a trainee employee in the context of an intra-corporate transfer, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the conditions referred to in subsection (2) sentence 1 nos. 2 to 4 are met. A trainee employee within the meaning of this Act is a person with a higher education qualification completing a traineeship for career development purposes or in order to obtain training in business techniques or methods, and is paid during the transfer.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The ICT Card is granted

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for the duration of the transfer but no more than three years, for managers and specialists,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: for the duration of the transfer but no more than one year, for trainee employees. The maximum periods stipulated in sentence 1 may not be exceeded by extending the ICT Card.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The ICT Card is not granted to foreigners who

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: owing to treaties between the European Union and its member states on the one hand and third countries on the other, enjoy rights of free movement equivalent to those of Union citizens,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: are employed by an undertaking located in one of those third countries, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: are completing a training programme as part of their studies.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Furthermore, the ICT Card is not granted if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the host entity was established for the main purpose of facilitating the entry of intra-corporate transferees,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner, in the context of the possible entry and stay in several member states of the European Union will spend more time in another member state than in the federal territory during the transfer, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the application is filed within six months of the end of the foreigner’s last stay in the federal territory for the purpose of an intra-corporate transfer.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: This provision serves to implement Directive 2014/66/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15 May 2014 on the conditions of entry and residence of third-country nationals in the framework of an intra-corporate transfer (OJ L 157, 27.5.2014, p. 1).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In derogation from section 4 (1), a foreigner is not required to have a residence title for stays for intra-corporate transfers not exceeding 90 days within a 180-day period, provided the host entity in the other member state has notified the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees and the competent authority of the other member state that the foreigner intends to take up employment in the federal territory, submitting the following at the same time:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner possesses a valid residence title issued by another member state of the European Union in accordance with Directive 2014/66/EU,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the national host entity belongs to the same undertaking or group of undertakings as the undertaking established outside the European Union by which the foreigner is employed,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a work contract or, if necessary, an assignment letter as stipulated in section 19 (2) sentence 1 no. 4, which have already been presented to the competent authorities of the other member state, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a copy of the foreigner’s recognised and valid passport or passport substitute,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that permission to work in an occupation has been granted or promised, if necessary. The host entity must make the notification when the foreigner applies for a residence title in the scope of Directive 2014/66/EU in another member state of the European Union. If, at the time of application, the host entity in the other member state is not yet aware of the foreigner’s intention to be transferred to an entity in the federal territory, it is to make the notification as soon as it becomes aware of this intention. If the residence title pursuant to sentence 1 no. 1 has been issued by a non-Schengen state, and if the foreigner enters the federal territory via a non-Schengen state, the foreigner must carry a copy of the notification and present it to the competent authorities at their request.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 2, and if the foreigner has not been denied entry and residence under subsection (4), the foreigner may enter the federal territory at any time during the validity of the residence title issued by the other member state as referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 and stay there for the purpose of the intra-corporate transfer. If the notification was made at the time referred to in subsection (1) sentence 3, the foreigner may enter the federal territory at any time after the notification is received and during the validity of the residence title issued by the other member state as referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 and stay there for the purpose of the intra-corporate transfer.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees denies the foreigner entry and residence if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the remuneration the foreigner will be granted during the intra-corporate transfer is less favourable than that granted to comparable German employees,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the conditions of subsection (1) sentence 1 nos. 1, 2, 4 and 5 are not met,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the documents presented pursuant to subsection (1) were fraudulently acquired, falsified or tampered with,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner has been staying in the European Union for more than three years, or, in the case of a trainee employee, for more than a year, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: there is a public interest in expelling the foreigner. In the cases covered by sentence 1 nos. 1 to 4, entry and residence are to be denied no later than 20 days after the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees receives the complete information pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 1. In cases covered by sentence 1 no. 5, the foreigners authority may deny entry and residence at any time during the foreigner’s stay; section 73 (3c) applies accordingly. The foreigner and the competent authority of the other member state as well as the host entity in the other member state are to be informed of the denial. Where entry and residence are denied within the allotted time, the foreigner must cease the economic activity without delay; the exemption from the obligation to hold a residence title pursuant to subsection (1) sentence 1 ceases to exist.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If, within 20 days of receiving the notification referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1, the foreigner has not been denied entry and residence in accordance with subsection (3), the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees is to issue the foreigner with a certificate confirming the entitlement to enter and stay in the federal territory for the purpose of an intra-corporate transfer in the context of short-term mobility.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Once a foreigner has been denied entry and residence under subsection (3) or the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees has issued a certificate within the meaning of subsection (4), responsibility for further measures and decisions under residence law rests with the foreigners authority, as set out in section 71 (1). The foreigner must inform the foreigners authority without delay if the other member state extends the residence title in accordance with subsection sentence 1 no. 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A Mobile ICT Card is a residence title in accordance with Directive 2014/66/EU for the purpose of an intra-corporate transfer within the meaning of section 19 (1) sentence 2, if the foreigner possesses a residence title which is valid for the duration of the application procedure and has been issued by another member state in accordance with Directive 2014/66/EU.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is granted a Mobile ICT Card if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner will work as manager, specialist or trainee employee in the host entity,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the intra-corporate transfer will exceed 90 days,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the foreigner provides a work contract valid for the duration of the transfer and, if necessary, an assignment letter stating

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: specific information regarding the place and kind of work, remuneration as well as other terms and conditions of employment during the transfer, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: evidence that the foreigner will be able to return to an entity belonging to the same undertaking or group of undertakings established outside the European Union after completing the transfer.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: If the application for a Mobile ICT Card is filed at least 20 days prior to the beginning of the stay in the federal territory and if the residence title issued by the other member state continues to be valid, the foreigner’s residence and employment are deemed permitted for up to 90 days in a 180-day period until the foreigners authority decides on the application.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The application is denied if it was filed at the same time as a notification in line with section 19a (1) sentence 1. Applications which were filed during the stay pursuant to section 19c, but not in their entirety at least 20 days prior to the end of this stay, are also denied.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: No Mobile ICT Card is granted if, in the context of the intra-corporate transfer, the foreigner will stay longer in the federal territory than in other member states.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The application may be denied if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the maximum duration of the intra-corporate transfer pursuant to section 19 (4) has been reached, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the ground for rejection referred to in section 19 (6) no. 3 applies.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: The national host entity is required to inform the competent foreigners authority without delay, as a rule within one week, of any changes to the conditions referred to in subsection (2).

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Foreigners may be granted a temporary residence permit for employment irrespective of their qualification as a skilled worker if it is determined on the basis of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that the foreigner may be admitted to pursue this employment.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner with a high degree of practical occupational skills may be granted a temporary residence permit to perform skilled work if it is determined on the basis of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners that the foreigner may be admitted to pursue this employment.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: In justified individual cases, a foreigner may be granted a temporary residence permit if there is a public interest, and in particular a regional, economic or labour market interest in the foreigner’s employment.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: Foreigners in a civil servant relationship with a German employer are granted a temporary residence permit to discharge their official duties in the federal territory without the consent of the Federal Employment Agency. The temporary residence permit is granted for three years, unless the employment is limited to a shorter period. After three years, a permanent settlement permit is granted, in derogation from section 9 (2) sentence 1 nos. 1 and 3.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: As a general rule, foreigners whose deportation has been suspended are to be granted a temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment commensurate with their vocational qualification, if the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has, in the federal territory,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: completed quality vocational training in a state-recognised or similarly regulated occupation, state-recognised training governed by federal or Land law as a health-care assistant, or higher education studies, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: held a position of employment continuously for two years in the federal territory with a foreign higher education qualification which is recognised or otherwise comparable to a German higher education qualification and which is commensurate with that employment, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: performed skilled work continuously for three years and has not relied on public funds for his or her subsistence and that of his or her dependants or other members of the household within the year preceding the application for the temporary residence permit except for benefits to cover the necessary costs for accommodation and heating, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has sufficient living space at his or her disposal,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has a sufficient command of the German language,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has not intentionally deceived the foreigners authority as to circumstances of relevance to his or her situation under residence law,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has not intentionally delayed or obstructed official measures to end his or her residence,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: does not have any links to extremist or terrorist organisations and does not support such organisations and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: has not been convicted of an offence intentionally committed in the federal territory; fines totalling up to 50 daily rates or up to 90 daily rates in the case of offences which, under the Residence Act or the Asylum Act, can only be committed by foreigners are to be ignored as a general principle. (1a) Where deportation has been suspended pursuant to section 60a (2) sentence 3 in conjunction with section 60c, a temporary residence permit is to be granted for a period of two years after the foreigner has successfully concluded this vocational training for employment commensurate with the vocational qualification acquired if the conditions referred to in subsection (1) nos. 2 to 3 and 6 to 7 are met (1b) A temporary residence permit issued pursuant to subsection (1a) is revoked if the employment relationship on which the issuance of the temporary residence permit was based is terminated for reasons relating to the person of the foreigner or if the foreigner has been convicted of an offence committed intentionally in the federal territory; fines totalling up to 50 daily rates or up to 90 daily rates in the case of offences which, under the Residence Act or the Asylum Act, can only be committed by foreigners are ignored as a general principle.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: The temporary residence permit entitles the holder to take up any employment after the foreigner has been employed in a position commensurate with his or her vocational qualification for a period of two years.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: The temporary residence permit may be granted in derogation from section 5 (2) and section 10 (3) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Temporary residence permit for the purpose of employment for qualified foreigners whose deportation has been suspended
Text: Subsection (1) applies accordingly if a foreigner possesses a temporary residence permit as referred to in Chapter 2 Division 5 which was granted pursuant to section 10 (3) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: A foreigner is granted a temporary residence permit for the purpose of participating in a European voluntary service scheme pursuant to Directive 2016/801/EU, if the Federal Employment Agency has granted approval in accordance with section 39 or it has been determined on the basis of the Ordinance on the Employment of Foreigners or by intergovernmental agreement that participation in the European voluntary service scheme is permissible without approval from the Federal Employment Agency and the foreigner provides an agreement with the host entity containing the following information:

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: a description of the voluntary service scheme,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the duration of the voluntary service scheme and the foreigner's hours of service, the placement and supervision conditions of the voluntary service,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
Text: the resources available to cover the foreigner's subsistence and accommodation costs and the minimum sum of pocket money the foreigner will have at his or her disposal throughout the stay, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory

Text: there is a public interest in expelling the foreigner. Entry and residence pursuant to sentence 1 nos. 1 and 2 are to be denied no later than 30 days after the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees has received the complete notification pursuant to section 16c (1) sentence 1 or section 18e (1) sentence 1. In cases covered by sentence 1 no. 4, the foreigners authority may deny entry and residence at any time during the foreigner’s stay; section 73 (3c) applies accordingly. The foreigner and the competent authority of the other member state as well as the notifying entity are to be informed of the denial in writing.

Text: In order to look for a job

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory

Text: foreigners are granted a temporary residence permit, if they finished their research activities as part of a stay under sections 18d or 18f,

Text: foreigners are to be granted a temporary residence permit once equivalence of the vocational qualification has been established or the authorisation to work in the occupation in the federal territory has been granted as part of a stay under section 16d,

Text: foreigners are granted a temporary residence permit after successfully completing training as an assistant or helper in a state-recognised or similarly regulated occupation in the field of health care in the federal territory, provided foreigners are permitted to take up the employment in question in accordance with sections 18a, 18b, 18d, 18g, 19c and 21.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Foreigners seeking employment following stays in the federal territory
Text: The temporary residence permit is granted pursuant to subsection (1) on the condition that the foreigner’s subsistence is secured. In the cases covered by subsection (1) nos. 1 to 4, the temporary residence permit is granted for a period of up to 18 months. In the cases covered by subsection (1) no. 5, it is granted for a period of up to 12 months and may be extended once by up to six months if the foreigner’s subsistence is secured. It may not be extended beyond these maximum periods.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: An opportunity card (Chancenkarte) is a temporary residence permit granted for the purpose of seeking employment or following measures regarding the recognition of foreign occupational qualifications.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: Holders of an opportunity card are entitled

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: to pursue employment of up to 20 hours per week and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: take up trial employment for up to two weeks, on the condition that

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: it is skilled employment,

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: it aims at vocational training or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: it can be taken up as part of a measure to recognise foreign occupational qualifications pursuant to section 16d.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: Foreigners may be granted an opportunity card, if

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: they are skilled workers or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: they scored enough points related to the features required by section 20b (1) as listed in the table annexed to this act.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: However, the opportunity card may only be granted if the foreigner’s subsistence is secured. Foreigners already residing in the federal territory may only be granted an opportunity card if they possess a residence title pursuant to Division 3 or 4. An opportunity card as referred to in subsection (3) no. 2 may only be granted if the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: either

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: has a foreign occupational qualification aa)  which is officially recognised by the country where it was acquired and bb)  which can only be acquired after completing training which takes at least two years, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: holds a foreign higher education qualification which is officially recognised in the country where it was acquired, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: has acquired a vocational qualification abroad by completing training whose content, duration and manner of execution meet the requirements of the Vocational Training Act (Berufsbildungsgesetz) and which is suited to enable the foreigner to work in an occupation with regulated training as defined in the Vocational Training Act or the Crafts Code (Handwerksordnung), with the qualification being granted by a German chamber of commerce abroad, and

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: the foreigner

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: demonstrates at least basic knowledge of the German language, or

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: demonstrates English language skills corresponding at least to Level B2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages. The foreigner is required to obtain confirmation from a competent German authority that he or she fulfils the prerequisites of sentence 3 no. 1 (a) or (b). The fact that the training abroad meets the requirements stipulated in sentence 3 no. 1 (c) is to be confirmed vis-à-vis the body granting the qualification upon its application and at its expense.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: Opportunity cards are granted for an initial period of up to one year (opportunity card for job searches, Such-Chancenkarte). The opportunity card may be extended by up to two years on account of an application filed during a stay under sentence 1, if the foreigner has an employment contract or a binding job offer for skilled employment in Germany and the Federal Employment Agency has given its consent (follow-up opportunity card, Folge-Chancenkarte). A follow-up opportunity card is only granted if the foreigner does not meet the requirements of other types of residence permits under Division 4. As long as the decision on the extension is pending, section 81 (4) applies to the extension of a follow-up opportunity card and the future employment, with the proviso that the foreigner concerned may only engage in the future employment referred to in sentence 2. Subsection (2) does not apply to the follow-up opportunity card. The card may not be extended as an opportunity card beyond the period stipulated in sentence 2. An opportunity card for job searches may only be issued anew if the foreigner, after the expiry of the last opportunity card for job searches, stayed abroad for at least as long as he or she stayed in the federal territory on the basis of an opportunity card for job searches.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: Section 9 does not apply in the cases covered by subsection (5) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Entry into and residence in the federal territory
SectionTitle: Opportunity card; authorisation to issue statutory instruments
Text: In order to manage labour migration, the Federal Government is authorised to issue statutory instruments not requiring the approval of the Bundesrat to restrict, annually or for shorter periods, the number of opportunity cards granted to foreigners not yet staying in the federal territory. As a rule, such restrictions are to take into account labour market and integration policy considerations and the capacities of the authorities involved.
