Text: When conducting job-related language training courses in accordance with section 45a, the foreigners authority, the Federal Employment Agency, the institution providing basic income support for jobseekers, the Federal Office of Administration and the private and public institutions conducting the courses are permitted to transmit to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees data relating to course participants concerning registration, length of attendance and the manner in which the course was concluded as far as necessary to grant admission to the course, ascertain and verify fulfilment of the obligation to duly attend, and to conduct and invoice the course. On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees may transmit the data transmitted in accordance with sentence 1 to foreigners authorities, the Federal Employment Agency, institutions providing basic income support for jobseekers and nationality authorities as far as necessary to grant permission or entitlement to attend an integration course, verify fulfilment of the obligation to duly attend, grant a permanent settlement permit or an EU long-term residence permit, supervise the integration agreement in accordance with Book Two of the Social Code in the version valid until 30 June 2023 or the cooperation plan in accordance with Book Two of the Social Code in the version valid from 1 July 2023, to integrate the foreigner in the labour market, or to conduct the naturalisation procedure. The private and public institutions authorised to conduct the job-related language training may inform the competent foreigners authority, the Federal Employment Agency or the competent institution providing basic income support for jobseekers of a foreigner’s failure to duly attend.

SectionTitle: Processing data in connection with integration measures
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees may transmit to state or state-recognised higher education institutions or to other research organisations financed primarily from public funds data relating to course participants concerning registration, length of attendance and the manner in which the measure referred to in subsection (3) sentence 1 was concluded, the type of course as referred to in section 12 (1) or section 13 (1) as well as the data transmitted in accordance with section 26 (1) nos. 1 to 5, 7, 9 and 10 of the Ordinance on German Language Training (Deutschsprachförderverordnung) as far as

SectionTitle: Processing data in connection with integration measures
Text: necessary for carrying out a scientific research project on integration issues,

SectionTitle: Processing data in connection with integration measures
Text: it is not possible to use anonymised data for this purpose, or anonymisation would require unreasonable effort,

SectionTitle: Processing data in connection with integration measures
Text: the legitimate interests of the persons concerned are not harmed, or the public interest in carrying out the research project significantly outweighs the legitimate interests of the persons concerned and the research purpose cannot be achieved in any other way, and

SectionTitle: Processing data in connection with integration measures
Text: the Federal Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs approves the transmission. The weighing-up of interests in accordance with sentence 1 no. 3 is to give special attention to the scientific interest in the research project as part of the public interest. No transmission is permitted without the consent of the person concerned. Information about the surname and given names, address, telephone number, email address and structural features of the person concerned which are urgently needed to initiate a project as referred to in sentence 1 may be transmitted without consent if necessary to obtain consent; the reasons for this need are to be provided in writing to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees. Personal data as referred to in sentence 1 are to be pseudonymised if possible given the research purpose and if it does not require unreasonable effort in proportion to the intended purpose of protection. Features which enable specific persons to be identified are to be stored separately. They may be combined with the individual details only if this is necessary for the research purpose. Features which enable specific persons to be identified are to be deleted as soon as the research purpose allows and no later than the end of the research project unless it is possible by way of exception to delete the data earlier. The data are to be anonymised as soon as the research purpose allows. The research organisation to which the data were transmitted may only process the data to carry out the research project. The data are to be protected against unauthorised disclosure to third parties. The research organisation must ensure that the use of the personal data is physically and organisationally separate from the performance of administrative tasks or business purposes for which these data could also be significant. As a general rule, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees is also, on request, to transmit to research organisations anonymised data needed to carry out scientific research projects on integration issues.

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: The Federal Criminal Police Office provides official assistance in assessing the data which are collected under section 49 by the authorities entrusted with implementing this Act and which are transferred under section 73. It may also use the identification data it has stored in the discharge of its duties. The data collected under section 49 (3) to (5) and (8) and (9) are stored separately from other identification data. The data referred to in section 49 (7) are kept by the authority creating the records. (1a) When providing official assistance under subsection (1) sentence 1, the Federal Criminal Police Office may, in order to establish the identity of the person concerned, also transmit the identification data referred to in subsection (1) sentence 1 to the public bodies of third countries which are responsible for examining the identity of persons, excepting the public bodies of the person’s country of origin and those of third states where he or she has reason to fear persecution or serious harm. The Federal Criminal Police Office is responsible for the lawfulness of the transmission. The Federal Criminal Police Office is to record the transmission and the reason for it. The body receiving personal data is to be notified that the data may be processed only for the purpose for which they were transmitted. Furthermore, the receiving body is to be informed of the date on which the data are to be deleted at the Federal Criminal Police Office. Personal data are not transmitted if there is factual evidence that,

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: taking into account the type of data and the way they were collected, the legitimate interests of the person concerned, above all his or her interest in receiving protection from persecution, override the general interest in the transmission, or

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: the transmission of the data would conflict with the person’s basic rights, the Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees of 28 July 1951 or the Convention on the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms, particularly because processing the transmitted data in the receiving state threatens to violate fundamental principles of the rule of law or human rights.

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: Processing the data obtained under section 49 (3) to (5) or (7) to (9) is also permitted to establish the foreigner’s identity or attribute evidence in the course of criminal prosecution or measures taken by the police to avert threats. These data may be transmitted or made available to the authorities responsible for these measures, to the extent and for the duration necessary.

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: The data collected under section 49 (1) are to be deleted by all authorities immediately after completing the authenticity of the document or the identity of the holder has been checked. The data collected under section 49 (3) to (5), (7), (8) or (9) are deleted by all authorities storing such data if

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: the foreigner has been issued with a valid passport or passport substitute and granted a residence title by the foreigners authority,

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: 10 years have elapsed since the foreigner’s last departure from the federal territory, the attempted unlawful entry or the termination of an unlawful stay,

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: three years have elapsed since refusal of entry or removal in cases covered by section 49 (5) nos. 3 and 4 or

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: 10 years have elapsed since application for the visa in cases covered by section 49 (5) no. 5 and since the voice recording in the case of section 49 (7). Deletion of the data is to be documented.

SectionTitle: Procedures to verify, establish and document a foreigner’s identity
Text: Subsection (3) does not apply if and for as long as the data are required in connection with criminal proceedings or to avert a threat to public safety or law and order.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: In individual cases in which there are concrete indications of

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: foreigners taking up employment or pursuing an economic activity without the necessary residence title under section 4,

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: violations of the obligation to cooperate under section 60 (1) sentence 1 no. 2 of Book One of the Social Code with regard to a department of the Federal Employment Agency, a statutory health insurance, long-term care insurance, accident insurance or pension insurance agency, an institution providing basic income support for jobseekers or a social welfare agency, or violations of the obligation to report under section 8a of the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act,

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: the violations specified in section 6 (4) nos. 1 to 4 , 7, 12 and 13 of the Act to Combat Clandestine Employment, the authorities charged with implementing this Act notify the authorities responsible for prosecuting and punishing the violations according to nos. 1 to 3, the institutions providing basic income support for jobseekers or the social welfare agencies and the competent authorities specified in section 10 of the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: In prosecuting and punishing violations of this Act, the authorities charged with implementing this Act cooperate in particular with the other authorities specified in section 2 (4) of the Act to Combat Clandestine Employment.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: The authorities charged with implementing this Act notify the competent authorities specified in section 10 of the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act of circumstances and measures under this Act, a knowledge of which is necessary for the purposes of benefits under the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act, the information they receive when approval for employment is issued to persons eligible for benefits under the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act and information relating to the expiry, revocation or withdrawal of issued approvals.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: The foreigners authorities immediately notify the bodies to be involved in accordance with section 72 (6) when

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: a residence title under section 25 (4a) or (4b) is issued or denied,

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: a period allowed for departure under section 59 (7) is set, reduced or annulled, and

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: competence is transferred from the foreigners authority to another foreigners authority; this obligation applies to the foreigners authority to which competence has been transferred.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: Upon request, the foreigners authority informs the court bailiff of a person’s place of residence for the purposes referred to in section 755 of the Code of Civil Procedure.

SectionTitle: Transmission of information by foreigners authorities
Text: In order to carry out enforcement proceedings, the foreigners authority informs the executing authority at its request of the judgment debtor’s place of residence. The foreigners authority may communicate the place of residence only if the executing authority is unable to obtain the information from the registration office and confirms this in its request filed with the foreigners authority.

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: The foreigners authorities immediately notify the competent registration authorities when they obtain information indicating that the data stored in the register on foreigners who are obliged to register with the authorities are incorrect or incomplete. They notify the registration authorities in particular when a foreigner who is obliged to register with the authorities

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: is resident in the federal territory and has not registered with the authorities,

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: has permanently left the federal territory. The foreigners authority informs the competent registration authority when it has granted a foreigner a settlement permit or an EU long-term residence permit.

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: As a rule, notifications under subsection (1) are to contain the following information on the foreigner who is obliged to register with the authorities:

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: surname, name at birth and given names,

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: date, place and state of birth,

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: nationalities,

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: most recent address in Germany and

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: date of departure and state of destination, and

SectionTitle: Notifications by the foreigners authorities to the registration authorities
Text: the Central Foreigners Register number in cases covered by and subject to section 10 (4) sentence 2 no. 4 of the Act on the Central Register of Foreigners, so as to allow a clear identification of the person concerned.

SectionTitle: Comparing data between foreigners authorities and registration authorities
Text: Foreigners authorities and registration authorities which share the same geographic area of competence exchange the data specified in section 90a (2) annually for the purpose of data maintenance. The receiving authority checks the transmitted data against its own stored data; automated checking is permitted. The transmitted data may only be used for data checking and data maintenance, after which they are deleted immediately; furnished data carriers are returned or destroyed immediately. The foreigners authorities immediately transmit any changes made as a result of the data check to the registration authority of the Central Register of Foreigners. Other statutory provisions concerning data checking remain unaffected.

SectionTitle: Data transfer in visa procedures via the Federal Foreign Office
Text: Data are transmitted in the course of visa procedures from German diplomatic missions abroad to the authorities involved in the visa procedure and then back again to the German diplomatic missions abroad by means of an automated process via a technical device for supporting the visa procedure operated by the Federal Foreign Office. The technical device ensures the complete, correct and punctual transmission of data referred to in sentence 1. To this end the data referred to in sentence 1 are stored in the technical device.

SectionTitle: Data transfer in visa procedures via the Federal Foreign Office
Text: Personal data may be processed in the technical device only as far as necessary for the purpose stated in subsection (1) sentences 1 and 2.

SectionTitle: Data transfer in visa procedures via the Federal Foreign Office
Text: The data stored under subsection (1) sentence 3 must be deleted immediately when the data are no longer needed for the purpose stated in subsection (1) sentences 1 and 2, and at the latest following issuance or denial of a visa or withdrawal of the visa application.

The data relating to expulsion, removal and deportation are to be deleted 10 years after the time limit specified in section 11 (1) sentence 2 expires. They must be deleted prior to this if they contain information which may no longer be used against the foreigner in accordance with other statutory provisions.

Notifications under section 87 (1) which are immaterial to an impending decision under the law on foreigners and which are unlikely to be of relevance to a later decision under the law on foreigners are to be destroyed immediately.

SectionTitle: Collecting and using data in cases of temporary protection
Text: The data on foreigners referred to in section 24 (1) who have applied for or have been granted a visa or a temporary residence permit as well as data on their dependants within the meaning of Article 15 (1) of Directive 2001/55/EC are stored in the Central Register of Foreigners in line with its applicable rules. The scope of the data to be stored in line with Article 10 of Directive 2001/55/EC takes account of the rules laid down in the applicable version of Annex II (a), to the extent that storing these data in the Central Register of Foreigners is provided for.

SectionTitle: Collecting and using data in cases of temporary protection
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees may use these data if necessary for granting residence, allocating admitted foreigners to places of residence in the federal territory, relocating admitted foreigners to other member states of the European Union, reunifying families and promoting voluntary return.

SectionTitle: Collecting and using data in cases of temporary protection
Text: On request, the data may also be transmitted to the member states of the European Union and to the European Commission to perform tasks pursuant to Article 27 (1) of Directive 2001/55/EC.

SectionTitle: Transfer of data by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees as the National Contact Point
Text: In its capacity as the National Contact Point in accordance with Article 27 (1) of Directive 2001/55/EC, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees may transmit the data contained in the Central Register of Foreigners to the following bodies for the purpose of relocating admitted foreigners to other member states of the European Union or reunifying families:

SectionTitle: Transfer of data by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees as the National Contact Point
Text: National Contact Points of other member states of the European Union,

SectionTitle: Transfer of data by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees as the National Contact Point
Text: bodies and institutions of the European Union,

SectionTitle: Transfer of data by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees as the National Contact Point
Text: other foreign, supranational or intergovernmental bodies, subject to the provisions of Chapter V of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and other general data protection provisions.

In its capacity as the National Contact Point within the meaning of Article 25 of Directive 2003/109/EC, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent authority of another member state of the European Union in which the foreigner concerned possesses the status of a long-term resident as to the content and date of a decision on issuing or extending a temporary residence permit under section 38a (1) or on issuing an EU long-term residence permit. The authority which has reached the decision transmits the necessary data to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay. The data required for notifications under sentence 1 may be transmitted to the National Contact Point by means of an automated process, using the Central Foreigners Register number. (1a) Requests from the foreigners authorities for information as to whether a foreigner continues to have international protection status within the meaning of section 2 (13) in another member state is forwarded by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees ex officio to the competent bodies of the EU member state concerned. To do so, the competent foreigners authority transmits the necessary information to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards the replies to the competent foreigners authority.

In the procedure under section 51 (8), the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards inquiries ex officio to the competent bodies of the member state of the European Union concerned, stating the intended measure and the key factual and legal grounds for the intended measure as stated by the foreigners authority. To do so, the foreigners authority transmits the necessary information to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards to the competent foreigners authority the answers received from bodies of other member states of the European Union in this connection.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent authority of another member state of the European Union ex officio that a foreigner who possesses long-term resident status in said member state has been informed of intention to deport or remove him or her
to the member state of the European Union in which the foreigner holds long-term resident status or

to a territory outside of the European Union or that such a measure has been carried out, or a corresponding deportation order under section 58a has been issued or carried out. The notification states the primary reason for terminating the foreigner’s stay. The notification takes place as soon as the German authority ordering the measure concerned in accordance with section 71 informs the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees of the intended or effected measure. To this end, the authorities referred to in sentence 3 transmit the necessary information to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay.

In the case of notifications under subsections (1) to (3), the foreigner’s personal details are transmitted for identification purposes. Where dependants who are living with the long-term resident as a family unit are also involved in cases covered by subsection (3), their personal details are also transmitted.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards inquiries from bodies of other member states of the European Union in connection with the consultation envisaged in Article 22 (3) (2) of Directive 2003/109/EC to the competent foreigners authorities. The competent foreigners authority furnishes the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees with the following information of which it is aware:
personal details of the foreigner with long-term resident status concerned,
residence- and asylum-related decisions which have been reached for or against the said foreigner,
interests in favour of or opposed to the foreigner’s return to the federal territory or a third country or

any other circumstances which it is to be assumed may be of relevance to the inquiring member state’s decision on residence matters. Otherwise, the competent foreigners authority provides notification that it is not aware of any pertinent information. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards this information ex officio to the competent body of the inquiring member state of the European Union. (5a) On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees informs the competent authorities of the other member states of the European Union within one month of receiving the inquiry whether a foreigner continues to have international protection status in the Federal Republic of Germany. (5b) If the long-term resident’s EU residence permit issued by another member state of the European Union to a beneficiary of international protection indicates that the person concerned has been granted international protection by said state, and if the responsibility for such international protection within the meaning of section 2 (13) has been transferred to Germany in line with the relevant legal provisions before the beneficiary of international protection was granted an EU long-term residence permit pursuant to section 9a, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees asks the competent authority of the other member state to change the indication in the long-term resident’s EU residence permit accordingly. (5c) If a person with long-term resident status in another EU member state is granted international protection in Germany within the meaning of section 2 (13) before he or she is granted an EU long-term residence permit pursuant to section 9a, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees asks the competent authority of the other member state to indicate in the EU long-term residence permit that Germany has granted this person international protection.
The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent foreigners authority ex officio of the content of notifications from other member states of the European Union
according to which the other member state of the European Union intends to carry out or is carrying out measures to terminate the residence of a foreigner who holds an EU long-term residence permit,

according to which a foreigner who holds an EU long-term residence permit has acquired long-term resident status in another member state of the European Union or has been granted a residence title or had his or her residence title extended in another member state of the European Union.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees receives applications under section 18f and forwards them to the competent foreigners authority. It informs the applicant of the competent foreigners authority.

On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees furnishes the competent authority of another member state of the European Union with the necessary information in order to enable the competent authorities of the other member state of the European Union to verify whether the requirements for the foreigner’s mobility stipulated in Articles 28 to 31 of Directive 2016/801/EU are met. This information comprises
the foreigner’s personal details and information on his or her identity and travel documents,
information on the foreigner’s present and former residence status in Germany,
information on completed criminal investigations or such investigations which are known to the foreigners authority,

other data concerning the foreigner which are stored in the Central Register of Foreigners or which originate from the foreigner’s file or the visa file and which have been requested by the other member state of the European Union. To this end, at the request of the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, the foreigners authorities and the diplomatic missions abroad transmit to the Federal Office the data required to provide the information.

The diplomatic missions abroad and the foreigners authorities may address requests for information to competent bodies of other member states of the European Union through the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, where this is necessary to check whether the requirements for mobility pursuant to sections 16c and 18e are met or to issue a temporary residence permit pursuant to section 18f or a corresponding visa. To this end, they may transmit
the foreigner’s personal details,
information on the foreigner’s identity and travel documents and on his or her residence title issued in another member state of the European Union, and

information on the subject of the application for the residence title and on where such application was filed and, where pertinent, specify the desired information in precise terms. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards information which it receives to the competent foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad. The foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad may process the data transmitted in the information furnished by the competent bodies of other member states of the European Union for this purpose.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent authority of another member state of the European Union in which the foreigner concerned possesses a residence title under Directive 2016/801/EU as to the contents and date of a decision on

denying, in accordance with section 16c (1) and 18 (1), mobility notified pursuant to section 19f (5), and 2  granting a temporary residence permit under section 18f. When a foreigners authority has reached the decision, it transmits the necessary data to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay. The foreigners authorities may transfer the data from the Central Register of Foreigners required for notifications under sentence 1 to the National Contact Point by means of an automated process, using the Central Foreigners Register number.

Where a residence title is revoked or withdrawn or not extended under section 16b (1), sections 16e, 18d or 19e or if it expires after the period under section 7 (2) sentence 2 has been reduced, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees informs the competent authorities of the other member state without delay, provided the foreigner is staying there under the scope of Directive 2016/801/EU and the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees is aware of this fact. The foreigners authority which has reached the decision transmits the necessary data to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay. The foreigners authorities may transfer the data from the Central Register of Foreigners required for notifications under sentence 1 to the National Contact Point by means of an automated process, using the Central Foreigners Register number. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent foreigners authority without delay of any case where it has been informed by the competent authority of another member state that a residence title held by a foreigner who is residing in the federal territory under sections 16c, 18e or 18f and which comes under the scope of Directive 2016/801 (EU) has expired or been revoked, withdrawn or not extended.

SectionTitle: Common provisions for intra-Community data transfer
Text: For the purposes of sections 91c to 91g,

SectionTitle: Common provisions for intra-Community data transfer
Text: personal details: personal details are defined as names, in particular surname, name at birth, given names and former names, date of birth, place of birth, sex, nationalities and home address in Germany;

SectionTitle: Common provisions for intra-Community data transfer
Text: details of the identity and travel document: details of the identity and travel document are defined as the type, number, issuing authority, date of issue and period of validity.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees is the national contact point as referred to in Article 28 (1) of Directive (EU) 2021/1883.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad may address requests for information to competent bodies of other member states of the European Union through the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, where this is necessary in order to check whether the requirements for short-term mobility pursuant to section 18h or for long-term mobility pursuant to section 18i are met. The authorities charged with policing cross-border traffic may address requests for information to competent bodies of other member states of the European Union through the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, where this is necessary to check whether holders of an EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union meet the requirements for entry and residence in the federal territory. In this context, the foreigners authorities, the diplomatic missions abroad and the authorities charged with policing cross-border traffic may transmit

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the foreigner’s personal details,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: information on the foreigner’s identity and travel documents and on his or her EU Blue Card issued in the other member state of the European Union, and

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the information that an application for an EU Blue Card has been filed and where it has been filed and specify the necessary information in more precise terms. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards information it receives to the authority that requested it in accordance with sentence 1 or sentence 2. The data transmitted in the information furnished by the competent bodies of other member states of the European Union may be processed

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: by the foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad for the purposes specified in sentence 1, and

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: by the authorities charged with policing cross-border traffic for the purposes specified in sentence 2.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent authority of another member state of the European Union in which the foreigner concerned possesses an EU Blue Card regarding a decision on granting an EU Blue Card pursuant to section 18g. To do so, the following data are transmitted:

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the data referred to in subsection (2) sentence 3 nos. 1 and 2, and

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the decision made concerning the EU Blue Card and the place and date on which it was made. If the application for an EU Blue Card is denied because the applicant has furnished false or incomplete information to obtain an EU Blue Card or because the applicant poses a threat to public security, public order or public health, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees transmits to the competent authority of another member state of the European Union information about these reasons for denial as well. The authority which made the decision referred to in sentence 1 transmits the data referred to in sentence 2 to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay. If an application for an EU Blue Card is denied for the reasons listed in sentence 3, the authority transmits to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees information about these reasons for denial as well.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees furnishes the competent authority of another member state of the European Union with the necessary information in order to enable the competent authorities of the other member state of the European Union to check whether the requirements for short-term mobility stipulated in Article 20 of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 or long-term mobility stipulated in Article 21 of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 are met. This information comprises

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the foreigner’s personal details and information on his or her identity and travel documents,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: information on the foreigner’s present and former residence status in Germany,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: information on completed criminal investigations or such investigations which are known to the foreigners authority,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: other data concerning the foreigner which may be stored in the Central Register of Foreigners or which originate from the foreigner’s file or the visa file, if the other member state of the European Union has requested them. To this end, at the request of the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, the foreigners authorities and the diplomatic missions abroad transmit to the Federal Office the data required to provide the information.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees transmits to the competent foreigners authority information about decisions which it receives from a competent authority of another member state of the European Union concerning a foreigner who is the holder of an EU Blue Card pursuant to section 18g and exercises his or her right to short-term or long-term mobility under Directive (EU) 2021/1883 in the other member state. If the competent authority of this other member state of the European Union states that the application for an EU Blue Card was denied because the applicant furnished false or incomplete information to obtain the EU Blue Card or because the applicant poses a threat to public security, public order or public health, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees transmits to the competent foreigners authority information about these reasons for denial as well.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The foreigners authorities may address requests for information to competent bodies of other member states of the European Union through the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, where this is necessary in order to check previous periods of residency that can be counted according to section 9b (2) sentence 1 for granting an EU long-term residence permit. To this end, they may transmit

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the data referred to in subsection (2) sentence 3 nos. 1 and 2,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the information that an application for an EU long-term residence permit has been filed, and

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the information as to where the application was filed and specify the necessary information in more precise terms. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards information which it receives to the competent foreigners authorities. The foreigners authorities may process the data transmitted in the information furnished by the competent bodies of other member states of the European Union for this purpose.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees furnishes the competent authority of another member state of the European Union with the information needed to enable the competent authorities of the other member state of the European Union to check whether the requirement of countable previous periods of residency in the federal territory as stipulated in Article 18 (2) (a) of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 for an EU long-term residence permit is met. The information comprises the data referred to in subsection (4) sentence 2 nos. 1 and 2. To this end, at the request of the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, the foreigners authorities transmit to the Federal Office the data required to provide the information.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: Requests from the foreigners authorities for information as to whether a foreigner continues to have international protection status within the meaning of section 2 (13) in another member state of the European Union is forwarded by the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees to the competent bodies of the member state concerned in order to enable the competent foreigners authority to check whether the requirements of Article 9 (5) or Article 23 (5) of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 are met. To do so, the competent foreigners authority transmits the necessary information to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards the replies to the competent foreigners authority.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees informs the competent authorities of the other member states of the European Union within one month of receiving the inquiry whether a foreigner continues to have international protection status in the Federal Republic of Germany in order to enable them to check whether the requirements of Article 9 (5) or Article 23 (5) of Directive (EU) 2021/1883 are met.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: If the holder of an EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union has international protection status in the Federal Republic of Germany within the meaning of section 2 (13), the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees will ask the competent body of the other member state of the European Union to include in the EU Blue Card issued in that member state the information that the Federal Republic of Germany has granted this person international protection status.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: If the EU Blue Card issued by another member state of the European Union indicates that this member state has granted the person concerned international protection status, and if the responsibility for such international protection within the meaning of section 2 (13) has been transferred to the Federal Republic of Germany in line with the relevant statutory provisions, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees asks the competent authority of the other member state to change the information in the EU Blue Card accordingly.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The foreigners authorities may transmit to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees the data from the Central Register of Foreigners required for notifications and for obtaining information from the competent bodies of the other member states in accordance with subsections (1) to (11) by means of an automated process, using the Central Foreigners Register number.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees transmits to the competent bodies of the European Union annually, for the first time no later than 18 November 2025, the data to be transmitted in connection with the granting of EU Blue Cards as stipulated in Regulation (EC) No 862/2007 of the European Parliament and the Council of 11 July 2007 on Community statistics on migration and international protection and repealing Council Regulation (EEC) No 311/76 on the compilation of statistics on foreign workers (OJ L 199, 31.7.2007, p. 23), last amended by Regulation (EU) 2020/851 (OJ L 198, 22.6.2020, p. 1) and taking into consideration Article 25 of Directive (EU) 2021/1883.

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees transmits the following to the competent bodies of the European Union at least once annually and every time a change is made:

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the factors defined for calculating the minimum salary levels in accordance with section 18g (1) and (2) and the resulting notional amounts,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: the list of occupations to which a lower minimum salary level applies in accordance with section 18g (1) sentence 2 no. 1,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: a list of the business activities allowed during a business trip under section 18h,

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: information about applying the labour market test to holders of an EU Blue Card, and

SectionTitle: Information to implement Directive (EU) 2021/1883 within the European Union
Text: a list of states and occupations for which the Federal Republic of Germany denies applications for an EU Blue Card for ethical reasons, including the reasons for denial.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees receives applications pursuant to section 19b and forwards them to the competent foreigners authority. It informs the applicant of the competent foreigners authority.

On request, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees furnishes the competent authority of another member state of the European Union with the necessary information in order to enable the competent authorities of the other member state of the European Union to verify whether the requirements for the foreigner’s mobility under Directive 2014/66/EU are met. This information comprises
the foreigner’s personal details and information on his or her identity and travel documents,
information on the foreigner’s present and former residence status in Germany,
information on completed criminal investigations or such investigations which are known to the foreigners authority,

other data concerning the foreigner which are stored in the Central Register of Foreigners or which originate from the foreigner’s file or the visa file and which have been requested by the other member state of the European Union. To this end, at the request of the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, the foreigners authorities and the diplomatic missions abroad transmit to the Federal Office the data required to provide the information.

The diplomatic missions abroad and the foreigners authorities may address requests for information to competent bodies of other member states of the European Union through the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees, where this is necessary in order to check whether the mobility requirements under section 19a are met or to issue a Mobile ICT Card. To this end, they may transmit
the foreigner’s personal details,
information on the foreigner’s identity and travel documents and on his or her residence title issued in another member state of the European Union, and

information on the subject of the application for the residence title and on where such application was filed and, where pertinent, specify the desired information in precise terms. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees forwards information which it receives to the competent foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad. The foreigners authorities and diplomatic missions abroad may process the data transmitted in the information furnished by the competent bodies of other member states of the European Union for this purpose.

The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent authority of another member state of the European Union in which the foreigner concerned possesses an ICT Card as to the content and date of a decision on
denying, under section 19a (1), mobility notified under section 19a (4), and
issuing a Mobile ICT Card under section 19b.

Where an ICT Card under section 19 is revoked or withdrawn or not extended or if it expires after the period is reduced in accordance with section 7 (2) sentence 2 is reduced, the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees immediately informs the competent authority of the other member state where the foreigner has made use of the possibility envisaged in Directive 2014/66/EU to carry out part of the intra-corporate transfer in another member state of the European Union, provided the foreigners authority is aware of this. The authority which has reached the decision transmits the necessary data to the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees without delay. The foreigners authorities may transfer the data from the Central Register of Foreigners required for notifications under sentence 1 to the National Contact Point by means of an automated process, using the Central Foreigners Register number. The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees notifies the competent foreigners authority without delay of any case where it has been informed by the competent authority of another member state that a residence title held by a foreigner who is residing in the federal territory under sections 19a or 19b and which comes under the scope of Directive 2014/66 (EU) has expired or been revoked, withdrawn, or not extended.
The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees annually transmits to the competent bodies of the European Union
the number
of ICT Cards issued for the first time,
of Mobile ICT Cards issued for the first time, and
of notifications under section 19a (1),
the nationality of the foreigner in every individual case, and
the period of validity or the duration of the planned stay in every individual case.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The Federal Government appoints a Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The Commissioner’s office is established at one of the supreme federal authorities and may be held by a Member of the German Bundestag. The Commissioner may also hold an office under the Act governing the Legal Status of Parliamentary State Secretaries (Gesetz über die Rechtsverhältnisse der Parlamentarischen Staatssekretäre), without requiring special approval (section 5 (2) sentence 2 of the Act governing Federal Ministers (Bundesministergesetz), section 7 of the Act governing the Legal Status of Parliamentary State Secretaries). In this case, discharge of the Commissioner’s duties remains unaffected by the legal status in accordance with the Act governing the Legal Status of Parliamentary State Secretaries.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The personnel and material resources required to perform the duties of the office are to be provided. The budget allocation is to be shown in a separate section of the individual plan of the supreme federal authority under subsection (2) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: Except in the case of dismissal, the office tenure ends when a new Bundestag is convened.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The Commissioner has the following duties:

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to promote the integration of migrants who are permanently resident in the federal territory and, in particular, to support the Federal Government in developing its integration policy, also with regard to aspects of labour market policy and social policy, and to provide ideas for the further development of integration policy in the European context;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to develop the necessary conditions for the most harmonious co-existence possible between foreigners and Germans and between different groups of foreigners, to promote mutual understanding and to counteract xenophobia;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to counteract unequal treatment of foreigners;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to help ensure that the interests of the foreigners resident in the federal territory receive due consideration;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to provide information on the legal possibilities for naturalisation;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to safeguard the rights of freedom of movement of EU citizens and to submit proposals on further arrangements to safeguard such rights;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to encourage and support initiatives to integrate migrants who are permanently resident in the federal territory, including such initiatives at the level of the Länder and local authorities and among social groups;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to monitor immigration to the federal territory and to the European Union and the development of immigration to other states;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to cooperate in the areas of the duties specified in nos. 1 to 8 with the bodies of the local authorities, Länder, other member states of the European Union and the European Union itself which have the same or similar remits as the Commissioner;

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: to inform the public in the areas of duties specified in nos. 1 to 9.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The Commissioner is involved at the earliest possible juncture in law-making projects of the Federal Government or individual federal ministries and in other matters relating to his or her remit. The Commissioner may submit proposals and forward opinions to the Federal Government. The federal ministries support the Commissioner in discharging his or her duties.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: The Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration submits a report to the German Bundestag at least every two years.

ChapterTitle: Commissioner for Migration, Refugees and Integration
Text: If the Commissioner possesses adequate information indicating that federal public bodies are committing breaches within the meaning of section 93 no. 3 or are failing to protect the rights of foreigners in any other way, he or she may require a statement. The Commissioner may attach his or her own assessment to this statement and forward the statement to the public body and that body's superior authority. The federal bodies are required to furnish information and to answer questions. The public bodies transfer personal data only if the data subject him- or herself has approached the Commissioner to request that he or she take action in relation to the public body on the data subject’s behalf, or if the foreigner’s consent is proven by any other means.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: The following persons are punishable with up to one year’s imprisonment or a fine: anyone who

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: resides in the federal territory in contravention of section 3 (1) in conjunction with section 48 (2),

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: resides in the federal territory without a necessary residence title as required by section 4 (1) sentence 1, if

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: he or she is enforceably required to leave the federal territory,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: he or she has not been granted a period for departure or this has expired and

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: his or her deportation has not been suspended,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: enters the federal territory in contravention of section 14 (1) nos. 1 or 2,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: contravenes an enforceable order under section 46 (2) sentences 1 or 2 or section 47 (1) sentence 2 or subsection (2),

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to furnish an item of information or furnishes incorrect or incomplete information in contravention of section 49 (2), where the offence is not punishable under subsection (2) no. 2,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to tolerate a measure specified in section 49 (10) in contravention of said section, 6a.  fails to provide notification, provides incorrect notification or fails to provide notification on time in contravention of section 56 (1) sentence 1, 6b.  contravenes an enforceable order imposed in accordance with section 56 (1) sentence 2, (3) or (4), 6c.  contravenes a geographic restriction pursuant to section 56 (2),

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: repeatedly breaches a geographic restriction under section 61 (1) or (1c) or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: belongs to an organisation or group in the federal territory which consists primarily of foreigners and whose existence, aims or activities are concealed from the authorities in order to avert the prohibition of said organisation or group. (1a) The same punishment is applicable to anyone who intentionally commits an act specified in section 404 (2) no. 4 of Book Three of the Social Code or in section 98 (3) no. 1, who requires a residence title under section 4 (1) sentence 1 in order to reside in the federal territory and only possesses a residence title in the form of a Schengen visa pursuant to section 6 (1) no. 1.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: The following persons are punishable with up to three years’ imprisonment or a fine: anyone who

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: in contravention of section 11 (1) or of an enforceable order under section 11 (6) sentence 1 or (7) sentence 1,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: enters the federal territory or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: resides in said territory or 1a.  contravenes an enforceable court order pursuant to section 56a (1), thereby preventing the competent authority referred to in section 56a (3) from continuously locating him or her, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: furnishes or uses false or incomplete information in order to procure a residence title or a suspension of deportation for themselves or for another or to prevent the expiry or subsequent restriction of a residence title or the suspension of deportation, or who knowingly uses a document procured in this manner for the purpose of deceit in legal matters.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: An attempt to commit an offence is punishable in the cases covered by subsection (1) no. 3 and subsections (1a) and (2) no. 1 (a).

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Objects related to an offence under subsection (2) no. 2 may be confiscated.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Article 31 (1) of the Convention relating to the Status of Refugees remains unaffected.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: In the cases covered by subsection (1) nos. 2 and 3, an act carried out without the necessary residence title will be deemed equivalent to an act carried out on the basis of a residence title obtained by threat, bribery or collusion or by furnishing incorrect or incomplete information.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: In the cases covered by subsection (2) no. 1a, the offence will only be prosecuted upon an application made by the competent body referred to therein.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: The following is punishable with a prison sentence of six months to ten years, in less serious cases with a prison sentence of up to five years or a fine: anyone who incites another person to commit or assists that person in committing

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: an act referred to in section 95 (1) no. 3 or (2) no. 1 (a) and

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: receives a pecuniary advantage or the promise of a pecuniary advantage in return or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: acts in such a manner repeatedly or for the benefit of multiple foreigners, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: incites another person to commit or assists that person in committing an act referred to in section 95 (1) no. 1 or no. 2, (1a) or (2) no. 1 (b) or no. 2 and receives a pecuniary advantage or the promise of a pecuniary advantage in return, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: incites another person to commit or assists that person in committing an act referred to in section 9 (1) of the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens (Freizügigkeitsgesetz/EU) and receives a pecuniary advantage or the promise of a pecuniary advantage in return. The same punishment is applicable to anyone who acts in favour of a foreigner who has not committed an intentional illegal act as referred to in sentence 1 no. 1 or no. 2.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: In the cases covered by subsection (1), the following is punishable with a prison sentence of no less than one year: anyone who

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: acts for gain,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: acts as a member of a gang which has come together for the purpose of committing such offences on a continuing basis,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: carries a firearm, if the offence concerns an act referred to in section 95 (1) no. 3 or (2) no. 1 (a),

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: carries another type of weapon in order to use said weapon in connection with the offence, if the offence concerns an act referred to in section 95 (1) no. 3 or (2) no. 1 (a),

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: subjects the smuggled persons to potentially fatal, inhumane or degrading treatment or a risk of serious harm to their health, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: attempts to avoid a police check in road traffic recklessly and in gross violation of road traffic rules and thereby endangers the life or limb of another person or another’s property of significant value. The same punishment is applicable to anyone who, in the cases covered by subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1, acts in favour of a minor unmarried foreigner who enters the federal territory unaccompanied by a person having the right of care and custody or by a third person who has taken charge or care of him or her, even if this person has not committed an intentional illegal act. In less serious cases covered by sentence 2, the penalty is imprisonment for a period of six months to 10 years.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: The attempt is punishable.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: Subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 (a) and no. 2, sentence (2), subsection (2) sentence 1 nos. 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6, sentence 2 and subsection (3), and in the case of entry by land also subsection (1) sentence 1 no. 1 (b), are to be applied to contraventions of statutory provisions on the entry and residence of foreigners in the territory of the member states of the European Union or of a Schengen state, where

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: such contraventions correspond to the acts specified in section 95 (1) nos. 2 or 3 or subsection (2) no. 1 and

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: the offender supports a foreigner who is not a national of a member state of the European Union or of another state party to the Convention on the European Economic Area.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners and persons to whom the Act on the General Freedom of Movement for EU Citizens applies
Text: Section 74a of the Criminal Code applies.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners into the federal territory resulting in death; smuggling into the federal territory for gain and as organised gangs
Text: Anyone causing the death of another person in the cases covered by section 96 (1), also in conjunction with section 96 (4), is punishable with a prison sentence of no less than five years. If in the cases of section 96 (1), also in conjunction with section 96 (4), the death of another person results at least from negligence, the punishment is life imprisonment or a prison sentence of no less than 10 years.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners into the federal territory resulting in death; smuggling into the federal territory for gain and as organised gangs
Text: Anyone acting for gain as a member of a gang which has come together for the purpose of committing such offences on a continuing basis in the cases covered by section 96 (1), also in conjunction with section 96 (4), is punishable with a prison sentence of no less than three years.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners into the federal territory resulting in death; smuggling into the federal territory for gain and as organised gangs
Text: In less serious cases covered by subsection (1) sentence 1 or subsection (2), the penalty is imprisonment of no less than one year.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
SectionTitle: Smuggling foreigners into the federal territory resulting in death; smuggling into the federal territory for gain and as organised gangs
Text: Section 74a of the Criminal Code applies.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Information concerning the specific planning of a deportation measure, in particular information under section 59 (1) sentence 8, constitutes a secret or item of information as referred to in section 353b (1) or (2) of the Criminal Code. The same applies to information on the specific planning, and in particular the date, of orders as referred to in section 82 (4) sentence 1.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Anyone who negligently commits an act specified in section 95 (1) no. 1 or 2 or (2) no. 1 (b) is deemed to have committed an administrative offence.

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Anyone is deemed to have committed an administrative offence who

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to furnish evidence in contravention of section 4 (2) sentence 1,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to submit to the policing of cross-border traffic in contravention of section 13 (1) sentence 2, 2a.  in contravention of section 47a sentence 1, also in conjunction with sentence 2, or in contravention of section 47a sentence 3, fails to submit, on time or at all, a document referred to therein, or to allow, on time or at all, his or her face to be checked against the photograph,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: in contravention of section 48 (1) or (3) sentence 1, fails to submit, on time or at all, a document or paper or a data carrier referred to therein, or fails to surrender the same on time or at all, or fails to leave, on time or at all, the same with the competent authorities, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: acts in contravention of an enforceable order under section 44a (1) sentence 1 no. 3, sentence 2 or 3, or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: in contravention of section 82 (6) sentence 1, also in conjunction with section 60d (3) sentence 4, fails to provide notification on time or at all. (2a) Anyone is deemed to have committed an administrative offence who intentionally or recklessly

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: in contravention of section 4a (5) sentence 1, commissions a foreigner on a sustained basis to perform paid work or services for gain,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to provide notification, provides incorrect notification or fails to provide notification on time in contravention of section 4a (5) sentence 3 no. 3 or section 19a (1) sentences 2 or 3,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: fails to provide notification or provides incorrect or incomplete notification or fails to provide notification on time in contravention of section 19b (7), or

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: in contravention of section 16g (4) or section 60d (3) sentence 3 fails to provide notification, or to provide it correctly, completely, in the prescribed manner or on time. (2b) (repealed)

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: Anyone is deemed to have committed an administrative offence who intentionally or negligently

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: pursues a self-employed activity in contravention of section 4a (3) sentence 4 or subsection (4); section 6 (2a); section 7 (1) sentence 4 first half-sentence; section 16a (3) sentence 1; section 16b (3), also in conjunction with subsection (7) sentence 3; section 16b (5) sentence 3 second half-sentence; section 16c (2) sentence 3; section 16d (1) sentence 4, subsection (3) sentence 8, subsection (6) sentence 3 or subsection (4) sentence 3; section 16f (3) sentence 4; section 17 (3) sentence 1; section 20 (1) sentence 4, also in conjunction with subsection (2) sentence 2; section 23 (1) sentence 4 first half-sentence; or section 25 (4) sentence 3 first half-sentence, subsection (4a) sentence 4 first half-sentence or subsection (4b) sentence 4 first half sentence,

ChapterTitle: Punishment of criminal offences and fines
Text: contravenes an enforceable condition imposed in accordance with section 12 (2) sentence 2 or (4), 2a.  in contravention of section 12a (1) sentence 1 does not take up residence in the Land in which he or she is obliged to take up residence or does not do so for the prescribed length of time, 2b.  contravenes an enforceable order imposed in accordance with section 12a (2), (3) or (4) sentence 1 or section 61 (1c),
